Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Keyscritter93
Reviews.Content: It's not that expensive, but you get nothing other than one pot of coffee included. No free Internet, no free TV, not even basic, stuff like an iron. The rooms are small and outdated and really need new carpets. On the positive side it is in the middle of the airport. If you have to stay, it is convienant. The staff were not that friendly, but neither were most of the customers I saw!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Marie_FI
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Miami by airplane in the evening and had a connecting flight in the morning. Because of the poor reviews we didn't have high hopes and for one night sleep the room was ok. Location is the only reason why we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, should have slept in the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia A
Reviews.Content: The sheets were dirty, the elevators dirty, the floor dirty, the room small and cramped. Motels at least clean their rooms one in a while. I don't think I'm being too picky at 175 a night. I didn't need luxury just minimal effort. Save your money. Chill in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you absolutely have to stay AT the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Freddy4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very disappointing. We stayed on the 7th floor in a deluxe king room. I found the room to be drab. There is rug in the room and it seemed very dirty to me not light like in the pictures. The very small bathroom was basic. They say on the website that you get spa amenities-HAHAHA that is ridiculous. They were the cheapest shampoo/soap available. It was freezing in the room. The KING bed was a weird shape, and the sheets only came to our midsection when pulled up. It seemed that the king bed was to short. We have a king and my husband is 6'1" and his feet hung off the bed. The only nice thing about this hotel was that it was located in the terminal. The Lobby is decorated hideously. I think it is privately owned and would benefit from a large chain buying this and updating the entire hotel. Gross.

Reviews.Title: “Little rundown but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn W
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in February 2012. We chose this hotel as it is right in the Miami Airport. The hotel had a great location, but the staff were rude and the room was outdated and a little rundown. It worked for us as we only stayed one night and we arrived at 2:30 in the morning due to a flight delay. It was in a convenient location and we liked that. The restaurant was actually better than we expected it to be. It was $200 canadian a night which was way too expensive for what you get. Although, as they say location, location location! I guess thats where the $200 a night comes from.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twytz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for convenience given an early flight the following morning. Finding the hotel entrance from the street was challenging given the small door and minimal signage.The room was pricy but clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were very accommodating, particularly the concierge in helping me retrieve my wifeâ€™s purse that was left behind in our rental car. We had no complaints regarding food and service in the hotelâ€™s restaurant. Finding food at the â€œcrack of dawnâ€� meant relying on limited airport concessions.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location if you're in & out of Miami”
Reviews.Author: Lenmeister3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as we had an overnight layover both on our way to El Salvador and on our way back. It was very convenient as it is located right in the airport in the same terminal we were leaving out of. The rooms were nice, bed was comfortable and even though they were a decent size everything felt very squished together. Didn't really bother us as we weren't there for very long. My only complaint is that is it quite expensive for one night (the price of convenience I guess?) If you are vacationing in Miami or on business I wouldn't recommend staying here as there are many nice hotels in Bayside or on Miami beach, etc. where you are closer to restaurants, clubs, downtown, etc. The airport itself is in a convenient part of the city. We managed to catch a Miami Heat game and only took 25 minutes to get there in "bad traffic." I would definitely recommend staying here for layovers, if you've ever traveled through Miami airport, you'll know what I mean. Give yourself at least 4 hrs to check in & especially to get through security as you'll need it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very practical but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Nelda68
Reviews.Content: As our flight was due quite late at MIA airport, I booked a room at this hotel to rest before hitting the road to get to our holiday destination on the Gulf coast. For that purpose, this hotel was ideal as located inside the terminal (no taxi/shuttle and no rental car need). If you are renting a car the following morning, a 10 min walk will get you to the new people mover linking the airport to the rental car building (and soon to Miami). So I'll stay at this hotel again, for it's "strategic location". The room was ok (asked for a high floor and got it; asked for a tarmac view and got the parking lot view instead). In the room, due to the beds occupying most of its surface, a column prevents you from getting too close to the window (this is an "artchitectural nuisance" but you can't do anything about that!). The front desk staff was nice (answered our questions, which is unusual in Miami, where front desk people usually ask "what they can do for you" and then they either don't answer or don't do anything!) and so were the housekeepers. Thank you! The bathroom wasn't spotless clean and previous strange guests had put a matchstick in the hairdryer, that would have caught fire, hadn't we noticed that before using the hairdryer. So attention to detail is essential for housekeeping to prevent fire hazards due to previous "weird" customers! The price, well it's more than at any other MIA airport hotels, but you pay for the "inside the terminal" location I guess. We also tried the rooftop restaurant, which was the average quality you can expect in Miami (see separate review) but not a place you'd like to go to, if not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight layover”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a more convenient location. The room was clean. The bathroom had great fixtures. The bed was comfy and there were good channels on the cable. Checking in was no problem. It was quiet at night. There is a nice little park area right outside to get a breath of fresh air. We were only here about 15 hours, but it's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “YUCKY!”
Reviews.Author: drox
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the location. It is right in the airport! At least you can fly easily out the next morning. Otherwise, it is yucky! I wore my flip flops just to get dress in the morning!!! One side of the hotel is over all the piping for the heating and cooling for the airport and the tarmac. The other side is over the roadway. Quiet rooms are non-existant. The air conditioning worked in our room. One of our party got up at 2:30 am and slept in the airport because it was cooler. If flying out early allow time for lines and checking out. They are either understaffed and/or very slow! Say here only when flying in and out. Never for any other reason. Note: The Top restaurant had very good food. Expensive but good. ($28 - $35/dinner). The Bacardi Lounge in the airport food court was very good and much less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience worth any negatives”
Reviews.Author: Fairbanks07
Reviews.Content: While this is not the finest hotel by any means, it is extraordinarily convenient. It has a wonderful restaurant, nice folks at the desk and any additional cost is offset by not having to take a taxi or hassle with a hotel van.

Reviews.Title: “slow service”
Reviews.Author: pers-imm
Reviews.Content: a Slow service and some rude staff are not really acceptable at 11 at night when someone uses the hotel after a long , exhausting experience with the flights. Surely that should be the the whole point of an airport hotel. On the upside, the room was clean and noise insulation excellent.

Reviews.Title: “when you need a rest”
Reviews.Author: CLAUDE B
Reviews.Content: After flying nine hours from Europe and spent nearly two more for standing in line , being photographed, fingerprinted and having to reply in writing and amazement if you seek admission with the intention to commit a crime or immoral act , then threatened with a jail sentence for innocently carrying a non declared apple in your briefcase, one may decide for the shortest stay possible before continuing for friendlier skies in the early morning, As one German co-passenger observed behind a hand: I thought this only existed at our Eastern border of old, but these guys are even worse With that distinct feeling that you have landed on hostile territory where every step you make could end you you in big trouble, you just need the nearest bed. This is where the Airport Hotel comes in handy.. It is reached after interminabloe concourses but still inside the terminal.The reception seems busy and the staff would not waste a smile. You could be Donald Trump or Donald Duck, they couldn't care, but at this stage you don't expect friendliness and, feeling like you came out of a dishwasher,you are hardly wasting any smile either.But the rooms and beds as well as all the amenities are comfortable and just what's needed to kick off a growing temper. You are assured of an undisturbed sleep so you get up , tighten your belt and step out again, looking for trouble. This place is reasonably priced and I can recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Only 5 hours”
Reviews.Author: Bavarianride
Reviews.Content: Because of rebookings due to airline delays and a midnight arrival in MIA, we chose the airport hotel because we were extremely tired from a transAtlantic flight mixed with airline delays. We were in no mood to do shuttles, etc. Told the lady at front desk I only needed a room for 5hrs. She offered a slight discount. Took our room key and headed to our room only to discover it didn't work. Returned to front desk, got an apology and reissued two new keys - those didn't work either. Security met us at the door to the assigned room and said he could open any door in the hotel - and he did. The door jam was on, so he couldn't open the door fully, because there was an occupant inside (good reason to always secure your door). He radioed to the desk, and was directed to take us up one floor to another room. Security entered the room to ensure there was nobody inside - it is now well past 1a.m. I immediately phoned the front desk and told the gal that I was extremely upset and that the occupant of the previous room put on his pants to come to the door to inquire what the problem was. She apologized profusely but blamed the computer. I told her I was not interested in hearing any more excuses as to who or what caused the problem. She offered an additional discount. Upon check out the next morning a gentleman was at the reception desk, and inquired whether we had a nice stay. I skimmed over the details but told him they have a safety and security issue that needs to be addressed. He apologized for the inconvenience, and issued the bill at a higher rate than the lady who worked the desk at night. He said he didn't know where she got that rate, but that it didn't exist. I told him I had lousy service, and I don't care who determines the rates, but he said he would honor it nonetheless. I paid and departed immediately. In all fairness, we had a good 4 hours of sleep in a very comfortable bed. The room was small by U.S. standards, but it had all the usual amenities you'd expect - nearly all of which we did not use or have the time to use. This hotel is suitable for emergencies, and its location is its greatest strength.

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was right in the airport - canceled flight”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: Worked for us - couldn't hear the planes, but could hear voices in the rooms around us. Inside walls thin, and we had to ask the people partying in the hallway outside our room to move along. Room was clean, and nice size, but hallway was in need of a paint and polish.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me!!!”
Reviews.Author: kco156
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we missed our connecting flight in Miami to Las Vegas. AA thinks you can clear immigration and customs in 1hr and 40 minutes. Got to the gate and even though we still had 8 minutes before departure they would not let us on even though luggage made it on the flight. We received a distressed passenger rate and decided to stay at this hotel for the convenience. Check-in was a breeze and the room was more than adequate. Loved the shutters on the windows. Room was clean, bathroom a bit small but ok. Went down to the lounge/bar for a drink and service was good. I noticed that check-in was pretty busy and was still busy when we checked out in the am. I think this hotel for me was a better choice due to the location. I did not have to go and wait for a shuttle or anything. I have seen this hotel many times during my stopovers in Miami but this was the first time I have stayed there. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK -- Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Small-Island-Nation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night in late January 2012 so we could catch a flight the next morning. Comfortable enough and very quiet despite being right at the airport, but it's not the Ritz. Low ceilings. Strange set up in the bathroom -- faucet handle bumped right into the shelf when you turned the water on. Nowhere easy to plug in the coffee maker, but at least they had one. Food delivered via room service was actually pretty good (had seared tuna with mixed greens and a reuben sandwich). The best thing about this hotel is you walk right out into the airport -- it's located at Terminal E.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExcellentAdventures
Reviews.Content: Being in the airport terminal is the biggest plus for this property. Rooms are expensive and less costly alternatives are available in the area. We had a 5:40AM departure so we chose this property due to our need to be at the airport check-in counter before 4:00AM.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has some less than average areas that need improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Jemma2
Reviews.Content: Check in: The room rate was not correct even though multiple e-mails were exchanged confirming my room reservation and rate. I asked to change rooms for a higher floor but was not told that the new room was "handicapped equipped". Result: Large bathroom with no space for toiletries, no toilet cover and an unnecessary walk in shower with sitting stool. Also, there was a tiny area in a dark corner with 3 hangers but no closet. Large armoire had coffee pot with no outlet to plug it in. Changes to accommodate the handicapped seemed unfinished or temporary. Called for an iron but it wasn't delivered. After second call I was sent an iron without an ironing board. Only outlet was on nightstand. Iron didn't work and water leaked out onto the towels on the bed.(Best I could do without the board) Overall, the hotel rooms and halls need painting and some renovation. Finally, I found someone from 'security' knocking on my door at 9:30 PM to ask if I had enjoyed dinner inappropriate, especially as a woman traveling alone. Needless to say, I did not open the door. Convenient location but next time will opt for a nearby hotel with shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Fills the need for some sleep time”
Reviews.Author: stjohnar
Reviews.Content: We had ten hour layover in Miami and having stayed here before selected this hotel once again. We were not disappointed. Rooms are excellent, clean, quite, large and well appointed. Check in and out speedy . Lobby has numerous eating areas within easy walking and reticketing areas very close by. Excellent choice if having a long layover.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to rest for a few hours..”
Reviews.Author: s_traveler050
Reviews.Content: Hotel good if: You are waiting for a connecting flight and really need some sleep. Location: In the airport and easy to find, but really tiny reception area. Service: Okay - Front desk person did not go out of her way to be friendly Hotel: Old and a little dirty in the halls. Rooms: They are quiet and you don't really hear the planes. What you do hear are people cleaning and slamming doors in the hallway while you are trying to sleep. My timing was unfortunate because I rented the room at 10:00 a.m. for a few hours and people were checking out and being noisy. The rooms are nothing special and are comparable to a motel 6, however it is really just a place to rest while you are waiting for another flight. It is nice to have a hotel located right inside the airport. Overall : Met my needs for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: lillesand25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the proximity to the airport, which really can't be beat. However, the rooms were small, old and dusty, the staff wasn't that friendly, and there is a fair amount of noise from the hallway and other rooms. Next time I'll take a shuttle to a nearby hotel for the sake of a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Dmphoo
Reviews.Content: The obvious plus of this hotel is that it is located within the airport. However, the rooms are small (as expected) and mine was dirty. There toilet seat in my room had not been cleaned which was shocking to me as their were visible dried urine on the seat. The room was soundproof from the planes but I could hear the child next door all night until the baby fell asleep. I will happily take a short bus ride to a nearby hotel rather than stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a day bed or a long flight delay”
Reviews.Author: kempr52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated between terminals at the airport itself. The bedrooms are basic, clean and adequate for a short stay and noise free which helps if you are fatigued. There is a decent restaurant at the hotel which is a bonus. Day rooms are available from 10 am to 6 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient clean overnighter”
Reviews.Author: knbmabry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a layover, arrived late at night and was pleasantly pleased by the clean King superior room. It was quite and nicely appointed, we will use this hotel in the future.I would recommend getting reservations

Reviews.Title: “Old, but closest to gate :)”
Reviews.Author: Lucia J
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked very used from inside. It need renovation. But its the most convenient hotel, cos is closest... Room was very small, but clean and bed with 9 pillows comfortable. Price is too much for this old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHarriet
Reviews.Content: Booked a day room and transfer by Super Shuttle when we returned from Carribean Cruise prior to homeward flight. Our room was booked from 10 am but checked in at 9.30 am without any trouble. Reception staff were pleasant and efficient. Had lunch in hotel restaurant which was good value. Room was large and perfectly adequate. Beds were comfortable. Sound-proofing between rooms non-existent. Hotel in need of renovation but suited our needs. Excellent location within airport terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise Day Room.....”
Reviews.Author: HippyChick55
Reviews.Content: Sat Jan 7th 2012...........We arrived off a cruise at Port Everglades, were picked up by a pre-booked/pre-paid SuperShuttle van and arrived here at 09.25 am. When reserving the room by email a month or so earlier, I was told the day room timings were 10am-6pm, but that if they could get us in earlier then they would. This was not to be however, so we sat about until 10.15 and then went to our room, number 439. The room was like a sauna as the air-con had been completely switched off (?) but we wacked it up to full on cold air and it was only a couple of minutes until I stopped thinking I was going to die...!!! There is a Subway beside the hotel in the terminal so we bought a sandwich each and drinks (missed breakfast on the ship) and settled down to relax for the day. The room was very nice with a King bed which was one of the most comfy hotel beds I have ever experienced, bathroom was large and clean with excellent shower/water flow, the bedroom curtain was a one-piece drape over-looking ugliness so good job it didn't pull open (!)..... Eventually we slept for a few hours, woke and showered, then went down in the lift directly into the terminal to catch our evening flight back to London. Very convenient all around....ok so it's not The Four Seasons, but all in all I would stay there again in an instance just for it's location & comfy bed alone.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, but so convenient!”
Reviews.Author: dis-spirited
Reviews.Content: We had a long layover (18 hours) on a recent trip and booked here because we were carrying loads of golf bags and luggage and didn't want to haul it all back and forth on a shuttle. Our room was small, faced the airport parking lot, had water damage on the ceiling and walls, wasn't very clean and even though the elevator had a sign/stop for the "pool/spa" and there really wasn't one -- crazy as it sounds, we would still recommend it! Living at the aiport,we had access to all the shops and restaurants, used the handy downtown express shuttle ($2 each) to go into South Beach, and were able to check in early for our international flight the next morning without waiting in line. The hotel could definitely use some improvement, but we would still recommend it for the convenience! (By the way, if you ever have to fly to South America - fly LAN Airlines - it's flying the way it used to be - big, new plane, lots of leg room, friendly flight attendants, free checked luggage, free tv/movies, drinks and food for all!)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location (just this)”
Reviews.Author: AnnaColagro
Reviews.Content: The room is big, clean, but dated and smelled like mold. You can't take the airport cart up the elevator so they kind of force the bellman on you. It was, however, perfect for us because we had an early flight and we were only a few steps away from the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Just not relaxing”
Reviews.Author: hereintop
Reviews.Content: Compared to the Tampa Airport Hotel, I was not overly impressed. On a positive note the hotel itself was clean and the restaurant was convenient, but I never felt relaxed. I would say that it would be alright if you had to lay over, but if you have the time, go somewhere off the airport property

Reviews.Title: “Yuk! This place is dirty and disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: nmclennan
Reviews.Content: One night is one too many at this hotel. Yes, it is convenient if you are arriving late to catch an early flight out the next day. If not, don't stay here. I notice the Manager of this hotel consistently responds to negative reviews with all sorts of comments about fixing issues and dealing with problems. From our experience his efforts must all be ignored. Front office staff are just plain rude and unhelpful - and we experienced different people at both check-in and check-out - so at least they are consistent in that respect. One receptionist would not break a bill for me. We were travelling with 6 large suitcases and we were not helped up to our room with our luggage. Rooms are dirty and fixtures and fittings are all old and damaged and we paid for the deluxe rooms. We would hate to see what a standard is like. Regardless of how late we arrived and how early our departure was, we would definitely travel out of the airport next time to stay at clean hotel where service was included!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you have an airport layover. The hotel is very average and a little worn, but if you have an overnight between flights it is ideal. Check- in took way too long but it was NYE and busy.

Reviews.Title: “Location 10 hotel 0”
Reviews.Author: Boniouk
Reviews.Content: The hotel couldn't have been better placed. We came out of departures and into the elavator, and when we came out, we were looking right at the check in desk. 100%, couldn't be better located for an airport hotel. But that's where the good points end. They spent about an hour on the phone trying to find the reservation, and when they did, no apology, it was as if it was my fault that they couldn't find it. The room itself was quite big, but full of furniture that reminded me of 1940s England. Old oak cupboards, a TV bigger than the bed, and an old cracked unclean bathroom. Not very nice. But you pay for location right?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: carac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice with my three year old daughter in the month of December. Both times we had layovers overnight, and early morning flights. I REALLy wanted to stay at this hotel because of the convenience, but I was concerned about the reviews I saw on TA. I decided to contact Paola directly - she is the Sales Manager at the hotel and often responds to people's reviews. She was fantastic, and was able to get us a great room both times. Our first stay we had a room on the 7th floor (can't remember the room number). The room was definitely smaller than we are used to staying in, but it was so wonderful to wake up in the morning, and be just a few steps away from the security checkpoint. We saved ourselves at least an hour of sleep, and for that alone, this stay was worth it. Check in and out was quick and easy. The staff were great with my daughter and made us feel welcome and appreciated. Our second stay was Dec 19th, and again Paola got us a great room on the 7th floor - room 747. This room was much more spacious than the first, and worked perfectly for our family. My daughter and I checked in in the afternoon, and got settled in. We found a number of convenient options for dinner just outside of the hotel lobby. My husband arrived in the evening from his international flight, and since it was past my daughter's bedtime, I put her to sleep and waited for my husband's knock at the door. He arrived so quickly after his arrival time, thanks to the fact that he didn't have to wait for a shuttle to the hotel. The next morning we flew out on Alaska airlines which is located right outside of the hotel lobby (again - so perfect!). We were able to sleep in an extra 45 minutes because we didn't have to deal with a hotel shuttle. As for the rooms, the beds were extremely comfortable, the decor was beautiful and it's obvious that they have been recently renovated. I loved the bathroom fixtures - very modern and sleek. Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel for an overnight stay. It's so convenient and saves on time and sleep, which we all know is precious when traveling. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lavonia V
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on 12/24/2011 and was disappointed as soon as we got off the elevator. The place is old with dirty carpet and small rooms. Our room had dirty towels and spots on the tile floor which indicated they had not been cleaned. wifi was an additional charge and there was a wall of blinds but only one tiny window that did not open. The was a evacuation announcement at 12:05am over the PA system. Everyone went into the hall confused, I called the front desk an was told "sorry that was a false alarm" - no announcement was made to let everyone know. Again at 2:45 am the same announcement was made with no follow up - I saw a security guard and he told me it was a mistake. The mistake was picking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pets!”
Reviews.Author: seasalt65
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone with two medium sized dogs I adopted from the Caribbean en route to Oregon. Needless to say, I was quite stressed. I was worried about the logistics of picking up the dogs in large crates from baggage, going through customs and immigration, and getting them to a pet relief area, as well as transporting them to a hotel. A nice porter helped me with the whole thing, even taking us outside to a pet relief area and waiting while the dogs did their business, before taking us to the hotel in the airport. It could not have been more convenient! The staff at the hotel was efficient, friendly, and helpful. We had to transfer the dog crates from the airport porter's trolley to the hotel porter's trolley then up to the sixth floor. I arrived in the late afternoon and had to catch an early morning flight. I must have walked the dogs through the hotel, down the elevator, through the lobby, and out to the dog area about five or six times, and every time the staff was friendly. The room was adequate for what I needed (bed and TV), and the dogs (who normally bark at every person walking by) slept peacefully because it was so quiet. The next morning a helplful hotel porter walked us all the way to our check-in counter. The whole experience could not have gone more smoothly!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: ajinternational
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve flown into MIA a number of times now, and I usually stay in a hotel off site. This time I was coming in on a late flight and leaving on another the next morning. Having had issues previously catching airport shuttles I wanted to make my journey as simple as possible. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. Arriving at concourse D and collecting my bags, I took the lift up one level to departures/check in and walked along to concourse E where the hotel was signed. Check in was efficient, the front desk clerk friendly â€“ there was a small queue but each person was dealt with in a timely manner. I was allocated a room on the 6th floor â€“ very little noise that could be heard. The view was over to the parking lot â€“ but for my stay that wasnâ€™t important. The room itself was larger than Iâ€™d anticipated â€“ having read in other reviews that there wasnâ€™t room to swing a cat I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean and well appointed - contemporary but neutral, large TV, coffee maker etc. I like the photos and pictures of Miami aviation history â€“ a nostalgic touch. The bed was very comfortable â€“ perfect, given that that was the main purpose of my stay here! The bathroom was fine â€“ it did look a bit worn and could have done with a deep clean, but for a one-night stay it was perfectly adequate. I imagine that the majority of people stay here because of itâ€™s location and thereâ€™s therefore a high turn over. For a one night stay this hotel is good value for money, in an unrivalled location, and Iâ€™d recommend it to passengers on a lay over.

Reviews.Title: “Close and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rotherham3
Reviews.Content: Close as you can be and so convenient if you have not lots of time - Miami is a super city, worth of a few days break - and attractions not too far from hotel - i/2 a day is enough, the more; the better!

Reviews.Title: “I guess two out three ain't bad.”
Reviews.Author: dobiman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Miami International Airport Hotel 3 times over the last couple of years. We have had early departures and wanted to be close so we could get some sleep before our long flight. The first two times were good. The rooms are small, but adequate and clean. This last time was, I would say a nightmare, but that would indicate sleeping, which there was none. We went to bed at around 9pm. We apparently had a room (6th floor) directly below the kitchen. The noise from banging pots and pans, furniture moving was very loud in our room. We called the front desk to see what the problem was. We were told that there was a late flight that the restaurant was accomodating. They said the hotel was full and we could not be moved. The noise continued, then an evacuation alarm went off twice. We called the front desk again and was told to ignor it. The noises continued to after 3am, at which time we had to get up to get ready for our flight. We got no sleep that night whatsoever. We complained to the front desk clerk upon checking out. She said that she would give us a refund, but it had to go through the company we booked with. (hotels.com) We were out of the country for 5 weeks. When we returned, we contacted hotels.com and explained the situation. To make a long story short, Miami International Airport Hotel did not refund anything, but Hotels.com sent us a $20 coupon for our next hotel booking with them. We were not happy with the outcome, but I hope this will give a warning to others. Don't take a room below the kitchen. If someone offers you something, get their name, position and exactly what they will compensate you. You can't hear airplanes, but the noise from the kitchen is much worse!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: joyce t
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel twice. the first time, i thought i would have to sleep in the airport chairs-and it was a ghost town at night. then we saw a hotel sign. thanks God. its an old hotel which doesnt matter. a very nice restaurant at the top. clean,quiet and a nice stay. a month ago my flight was 2 hr late getting into the air and i missed my flight to los angeles. so i remember this hotel and it was all good. got on standby the next day and i was grateful to get a spot. in jan 2012 im flying back to miami and i will stay there again. this time i am making a reservation ahead of time. plus its located in one of the terminals. terrific thank you MIA hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis during a layover!”
Reviews.Author: Beetduck
Reviews.Content: Great Customer service: especially that of the front desk supervisor who was very accommodating in my time of need! Clean, quiet, well equipped, very comfortable rooms: Truly sound proof! There was a large flat screen TV, Clean, comfortable bathroom, comfortable bed, a clock with local time and even a great view! The security and concierge staff were very friendly and helpful. There was also a convenient hotel restaurant as well as many surrounding restaurants in the terminal. The environment was calm and entirely the opposite of the busy confusing airport. The room I stayed in was excellent value for money: a real oasis. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy...!”
Reviews.Author: Chris2421356707655
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly located right in the terminal, however it is very old and tired and the walls of the building are very thin. If you stay there, be sure to get a room without a connecting door as the constant coming and going of guests is extremely noisy. (I had to change room in the middle of the night...)

Reviews.Title: “Great for a tight connection with overnight stay. basic clean accomodation”
Reviews.Author: intorox61
Reviews.Content: I had a late flight arrival from LAX, departing early morning for Brasil. The airport hotel is directly in terminal E of the airport and accessible to all gates. The rooms are very basic, nothing too excting but the price is fair and the room and bathroom are clean. Futhermore it was surprisingly quiet for an airport hotel and I had a great sleep. Woke up at 3.30 am to catch my onward flight. No hassles at check out and better still no shuttle bus to take!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Smoghead
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel as I needed to overnight between flights. The location is excellent and the rooms were clean, in fact one was so clean the carpet was still wet from the cleaning. The prices vary depending on how far in advance you book and last minute charges are expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A real mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: travelerofworld
Reviews.Content: The convenience of this hotel for a very early morning flight is the only reason to stay here. We have stayed at airport hotels all over the world and this is by far the worst. A real embarrassment to Miami International Airport. The hotel smells of stale smoke and mildew everywhere. The elevators are very slow. Very old style televisions. Our desk had no chair, only an ottoman! Furniture very old and used. Rooms and bathrooms very small (but this is understandable for the location.) The bed was reasonably comfortable, however, and the hotel was quiet for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel and no HOT water”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived at 9.30pm and we were in our room in less than an hour as immigration and customs were quick. We were surprised at how little was open in terms of eating places at 10pm, although there is a Dunkin Donuts and another sandwich place nearby on the concourse but don't expect to be able to get a late full meal. The hotel has an excellent location within terminal building but that is the only really plus point. Corridors etc looking shabby and the room was quite small with a small and soggy bed (1.5m) by American standards. Bathroom pretty reasonable size. No room safe or fridge/mini bar. With only warm, not hot, water when we arrived we expected it to be hotter in the morning but it was not. As a result we negotiated a 20% discount prior to check out. The rate was still 120 Dollars inc tax, so expensive for what it is HOWEVER the location could not be better and just what you need when arriving late and departing early the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Useful if a bed is absolutely necessary...”
Reviews.Author: FionaMKent
Reviews.Content: I landed in Miami at 4 pm and was departing early the next day (0800), this hotel was booked for me by Virgin. In retrospect I should have travelled into Miami itself and make the most of the time... Instead, I walked round and round the airport like Tom Hanks in 'The Terminal' It is the most godforsaken airport I recall, with little to do... other than eat fast food!! The Hotel rooms are adequate, small and fairly clean, but it is not a place I'd choose to stay again. A gym / fitness room would possibly reduce the boredom. Great place if you just have a few hours to put your head down on the other hand!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for overnight connection”
Reviews.Author: FlyGuy47
Reviews.Content: This one's nothing special really... it's "no-frills" and the room was basic and small, but clean and it works as a place to catch a few hours sleep when you have an overnight flight connection through MIA. I didn't have any of the problems other people have mentioned in reviews here, but it is clear that they place could use some refurbishment. Can't beat the location for a layover, though (right there on the 2nd floor of Concourse E). Rooms apparently have very thin walls - I had my TV on very low (could barely here it from my bed), but a security guy banged on my door to tell me to turn it town (his knock on the door was louder than the TV!); that was sort of strange. There's a shortage of places to eat if you get in late -- other than the overpriced restaurant up on the 7th floor, only the nearby Subway was open at 9:30 p.m. At the $159 I paid, it's probably priced on the high side and not a great value, but you're paying for convenience and location, not amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Our Small Queen Standard Room wasn't good...”
Reviews.Author: thepinheiros
Reviews.Content: We got a "Small Queen Standard" which is one the cheapest rooms they got. Right after I entered the room, it smelled cigarettes. Really gross. BUT they were very kind and immediately changed our room. It was still small and nothing appealing about it but we only needed a place to crash and take the flight early next day. The staff was nice. I would only recommend this hotel if you're just passing through and need a place to rest before flying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrible Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jaime B
Reviews.Content: I never write a review but I made it a point to go online and write this because it was the worst hotel experience I had in the world!!!!!!!!!!! We decided to stay in the airport as we had two 6am flights and we thought it was a good idea. We were horribly wrong!!!! First - The rooms are antiquated and very small, I had to upgrade to a junior suite just so my fiancee could stay with me. The upgrade cost $320 dollares for 5 hours of sleep. 2nd - The tv and on demand did not work. The linens were horrible and cheap. No internet 3rd - After we started drifting to sleep there was a loud hammer banging for about 3 hours from 1 to 4 am. The hotel played dumb and said that they didnt know, but it was clear that it was construction going on for the hotel, lots of people complained. Comeon guys you offer a bad service atleast let the people sleep. 4th - There is basically no service and the people treat you very bad. Because they attend to a crowd that need to stay there because of the location they dont care how people are treated. I would never recomend this hotel even to my worst enemy. Jaime

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Dreary”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at this hotel was in 1998. Unfortunately, as far as I can see, the hotel hasn't been renovated since that time. The rooms are tired and dreary. However, they were clean and comfortable but for the price I would have expected a little more contemporary decor. In addition, the bar is stuck in the 1980's and somebody should attend to the door from the airport side of the hotel bar as it is seriously flawed. Although I got a warm welcome from the lady in the bar, the receptionist seemed stressed and moody which I guess might be due to her long shifts (I checked in around 7pm and she was still working the next morning at 9am). In short, it's not by any means a terrible place to stay but just needs some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rperez03
Reviews.Content: It is a clean and confortable and easy to access from the airport. But you have to consider before make a reservation several points: 1.- They do not have their own wireless system, if you want to have wireless you have to conect to the airport one. For me this was a contraint do to I do not like to use my credit anywhere. 2.- Parking: if you rent car you have to pay $17 for every night and $8 each time you need left for a minute the car. For me, this was a problem!! Next time, I will stay in another hotel that offer all the services that I looking for. If you are looking for Hotels at Miami be careful when compare prices!! In my case, Miami Intl Airport Hotel is much expensive than others are best class.

Reviews.Title: “rude and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: harvIowa
Reviews.Content: we ended up cancelling our reservation as staff was not helpful in providing information as to how to get from baggage area to their hotel ---- so rude we ended up staying @ Miami Holiday Inn and it was great !!!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are stuck”
Reviews.Author: Nexttripflash
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a very early flight the next morning and wanted to return my rental car the night before. The room was VERY TINY with scratchy sheets and no view. The room service was good as was the food, but I think you can get much better value nearby. The room was old and, as another viewer said, claustrophobic. I would only stay here again if necessity dictated it. ALSO, it is impossible to find the place at the airport and I used to live in Miami!! I had to call from offsite and ask where they were!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here if you have to drop of luggage!”
Reviews.Author: dougk2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the airport, but they do not have any carts that you can load your luggage on and take up to your room. I got one of the rental carts, but I could not take it up to the room. I had to wait for a bell man to move the luggage from the airport cart to his bell hop cart. There were lots of people in front of me and airport security was â€œhoveringâ€� to make sure I did not leave my luggage unattended. Normally I could have handled my luggage on my own, but the person I was traveling with had to return the rental car and I could not get all of the luggage by myself. There was only one bell hop, so it was a long wait and could not leave to go to the bathroom. The room was OK and it was quiet, but it would have been easier to stay off site and take a shuttle to where you need to fly out. I also got there after 9pm and there was nothing open to get any food.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: hiyahVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my way back from Costa Rica. It was perfect for what I needed. I place to sleep before my early morning flight. It's right by the luggage pick up. The staff were nice and got me checked in quick and they even gave me a better room rate than the one I had reserved online. The rooms were nice, clean and beds were comfortable. The only downside was that my flight was later than I expected so the hotel kitchen was closed - the only option was the subway in the airport lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: mfoulks
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here overnight for a flight the following day. The hotel decor is out of date, very 70's ish, but it's suitable. The beds were comofortable, the room was a decent size but the bathroom was a little small. Fairly quiet. It was nice being able to stay within the proximity of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Well needed after a long trip”
Reviews.Author: SLynn743
Reviews.Content: Booked a room after missing a connecting flight due to customs and was delighted at the service and quality of this hotel. The location right in the airport is great for catching that early flight back home too!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: OregonTraveler7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient for travelers not wanting to leave the airport. The showers are great. The beds are too soft. The rooms are not very spacious. But if you arrive late and are leaving early the next morning, it's fine. Would like free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, atmosphere awful!”
Reviews.Author: Steve112975
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel is actually in MIA it will probably stay open a lot longer than it should. Room smelled and you could barely move around the room with how small it was in comparison to the size of the bed. The sink and tub drains were both horribly clogged. So nasty I did not take my shoes off to sleep. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Big positive from a negative”
Reviews.Author: Kennebec1
Reviews.Content: I want to commend the Hotel, and in particular its Sales Manager Mr. Paola Pinillos, for how an unfortunate incident at the Hotel was turned into a very positve experience. My wife was travelling solo, staying overnight at the Hotel after a Bahamas cruise, and catching a plane home to Maine the next day. She checked in very early, about 10 AM, and was told, understandably, that a room wouldn't be ready until noon, which she understood and accepted. At noon she spoke to a different desk clerk who told that the room now wouldn't be ready until 1PM. My wife glanced over at the other desk clerk who had originally said the room would be ready at noon, saying nothing at all to her, and the newer clerk, observing this, told my wife "and the room may be available much later if you keep looking at my co-worker like that". Now, I don't like how my wife looks at me sometimes, either: I'm usually in some kind of trouble if she does that. But I'm a husband, and that's to be expected; but from a hotel desk clerk, well, you don't really expect commentary so breathtakingly rude and arrogant. So my wife, fearing that if she angered the clerk further might find herself without a room, period, went to the lobby where she had a seat, then called and related the story to me at my office 1700 miles away. Now, I was more flabbergasted than angry, but I was also a little angry. I had checked out the reviews for this hotel previously on this site, and had noted how hotel staff checked the comments, and seemed to appreciate all of them, even the negative ones, evidently viewing those as an opportunity to improve service to its customers. So I found a name of a Sales Manager who was commenting frequently in appreciation of the visitors comments, a Mr. Paola Pinillos. So I called the hotel and asked for him. They put me through and he immediately answered. I very calmly explained what had happened; Mr. Pinillos seemed appalled at the clerk's behavior and commentary, and asked me to hold for a moment, which I did. When he returned to the phone maybe 3 or 4 minutes later he advised me that the situation had been rectified. I thanked him for his assistance. A few minutes later my wife called from her room. She said a security guard had come up to her and brought her to the counter where she was checked in by the previously rude clerk, who was now very friendly, courteous and helpful, and taken to her room which the hotel had upgraded for free. Now, I had made no demands or threats of or to Mr. Pinillos; I recognize that the clerk, like anyone, can have a bad moment, but I did believe that Mr. Pinillos would care about a situation like this, which he obviously did. My wife and I both appreciate it, and she would without hesitation stay again at the Miami International Airport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dingy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alan305
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by online pbotos. This hotel is nothing more than a dirty little roach motel. The rooms are tiny and old, reminiscent of an older red roof inn. I'm in a King Superior room and it is tiny. I couldn't roll my carry on between the TV and bed! That's how narrow the room is. The floors are filthy, and it dusty. The furniture is old and dirty. Pay less and stay at a name brand close by the airport. Even though it's conveniently located in the airport, it's not worth it! I'm praying I don't end up with bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean and Not Much Else”
Reviews.Author: mijayati
Reviews.Content: We had a layover and chose this hotel because of convenience. And it was fine for our needs. The space was very cramped and there was barely room to move around. But, the room was spotless and had a good shower and comfy beds. Really all that you need for short stays where sleep is more important than amenities. We would use this hotel again for layovers. A side note: we would never pay the full price for this place - think it's $160 for a double. We traded in some RCI points and paid $8 for the room. It is not worth $160 IMO, but then again, with check-in for departures practically outside the hotel's entryway, maybe it would be worth it for some.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay there again anytime I am in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Joan O
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the amenities and the cleanliness. The beds are very soft and comfortable. The floor feels clean. It is very conveniently located particularly for stay over visitors. We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: sissa2691
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times at this hotel, either a day room or for the night when catching an early flight. The location is very convenient being right inside the Miami aiport. Rooms are very comfortable, room service excellent. Our only complaint if any is the check in area which is very busy with lots of people hanging around with bags and the front desk staff are not always the most helpful, but once past that, its a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jukette1980
Reviews.Content: The only reason I give 3 stars is because I could not sleep at all that night, there was a weird noise in the bedroom, although I need to give them credit for the location (Concourse E inside the airport), very clean room, great rate for a studio (not listed anywhere just ask for a studio when u get there only $99 a night), twin bed was comfy, no noises coming from the airport. The front desk was OK friendly, they can do better than that! I called next day to complain about the noisy in my bedroom, even tough, I didnt request a refund they refunded $30 of the $111 I paid with taxes. So, that's great customer service! Wake up call right on time, too.

Reviews.Title: “Security guard burst into room at 2 AM demanding that I leave”
Reviews.Author: gebw
Reviews.Content: Having an early morning connecting flight, and being in need of a good night's sleep, I chose to stay at the Miami International Airport Hotel and I made a reservation. I read some negative reviews about the personnel but was happy to find the front desk personnel most pleasant and seemingly efficient. At 2 AM a male and a female security guard burst into my triple locked room and told me no one was supposed to be in this room and that I had to get dressed and leave. I refused, saying that I had made a proper reservation, had duly paid and had been checked in and given a key. They left, only to return ten minutes later loudly demanding my name and proof of registration. It took awhile for the security guard to relay this information at great volume through a poorly-functioning radio, by which time everyone on the corridor was wide awake. Again they demanded that leave, and I again refused. I remained in the room, but could not sleep and think the situation could have been terrifying if I had not been so angry. At check out, the morning front desk staff courteously apologized after hearing my complaint. But some kind of internal procedure needs to be changed there.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, Fast and some hours to rest”
Reviews.Author: MAJonTour
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a child (2 years) we did not want to go through taxis, rental car, pick up, etc. so we decided to stay "in" the airport for the night. Not the first time the hotel has everything you need to make the max out of your stay. We arrived late and departured early. In the hotel, Room Service for dinner, coffee and some danish in the morning and the stay in Miami was over. Even that it is a bit more pricy, you don't have to be worried about pick up in the morning, delays while checking out or your walk through the airport. Out of the elevator straight to check in. More you don't need. Very comfortable. With view over the runway we could not ask for more. What elese do you need to keep your 2 year old son entertained. Thank you for a great night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Take a shuttle elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Ballardbfj
Reviews.Content: Good location yet the worse experience and not worth it. Take a shuttle to another near by hotel and have a much better experience at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Take the extra time to leave the airport!”
Reviews.Author: tobdan5
Reviews.Content: Front staff was bothered by our existance and after the third time of returning to the front because our key did not work they were even less friendly! The rooms are old, small, and not exactly clean. Our wonderful view of the planes taking off and landing(as noted in the description of the hotel) did not exist in our case...we had a curtain that covered the entire wall and when the kids moved it to see the planes they were able to see the side of the parking garage through a 3'x2' dirty window! What a spectacular sight! The entire reason we booked 'at the airport' was because they are usually top notch hotel accomodations and it was very convenient since we had to catch a flight in the morning...my advice in this case is to leave the airport unless you like staying at motel 6... for $125! There are many hotels that have shuttles and are very close, within a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Short Layovers”
Reviews.Author: FlyingT-Rex
Reviews.Content: This place is far from perfect, but works great for short layovers. Several times a year we go through Miami on trips that arrive around midnight with a connection sometime late-morning the next day. I figure we save almost two hours (time spent waiting for an off-airport hotel shuttle operating on Miami time, and driving to hotel...both going and coming) by staying here. No, I wouldn't stay here if I have two or three days to kill in Miami, but I wouldn't stay anywhere else with less than 12 hours between flights. Here is the skinny (based on two stays here this year in a king room): The rooms are very small and have very small windows, but they are nicely (not fancy) decorated and have nice bathrooms with stone floors and a rain shower. The rooms seem to have good noise insulation from the airport, but you'll have an occasional slamming door from inconsiderate guests entering/leaving their room. The price was comparable to three star off-airport hotels, with the trade-off being room size for location. This hotel is what it is...and management seems to understand this. This is not a hotel that we love, but it is one that we appreciate...

Reviews.Title: “Wouln't stay here for a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: TX_Duck_Hunter44
Reviews.Content: Pay for a cab and go stay a well known hotel chain nearby if you have the time. My wife and I stayed on a layover going to St. Lucia and it was less than desirable to say the least. The lobby was tiny and packed with foriegn travelers, the bar was dim and dirty, the staff was quick and helpful but that's where it stopped. When we got to the room you could tell this was a very old hotel. The furniture and TV were very dated and everything just seemed cramed in the room. Airport noise wasn't a problem, it was evryone in the other rooms you could hear. Showers, toilets, alarm clocks, snoring, conversations, hallway traffic, phones, it was awful. The sheets were stained and almost felt starched. We ended up getting out of bed and just waiting in the concourse for our morning flight. Oh yeah, and it cost us $150!!! Do yourself a favor and pass on the convienence of this hotel and find a reputable one.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: karla1104
Reviews.Content: The customer service was excelent and the room was very comfortable. Impress with the Hotel managment. Great improvements!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight”
Reviews.Author: javsigx101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice if you get stuck at MIA overnight as I was. Best thing about the property is that you don't have to exit the airport to gain entrance, saving time waiting for a nearby hotel's shuttle or a taxi. The only real drawback are the elevators. One only seemed to work and that one worked poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beaten for an overnight stay in MIA”
Reviews.Author: Mot-de-pass
Reviews.Content: I've stayed before in this hotel, but I never got to write a review about it. However, I'm sure by now most people know how convenient it is to stay at Miami International Airport Hotel when you have an overnight with an early flight the next day, when you got to MIA late, tired and don't feel like driving around in a cab to look for a hotel room, or when you just want to rest before going on other business the next day...Whatever your reasons are, this hotel can provide you with the peace of mind of not having to go through the hassle of getting out of the airport and having to deal with public transportation, especially after a long flight. Located right inside the airport, one floor up of the International arrival, you couldn't find a better location for an airport hotel. I came in from Europe through Chicago, and found out on the way that I had to go all the way to Orlando to take care of some business. I decided to drive from Miami to Orlando, but could not do it the same day of my arrival, I needed to rest. And I had 3 luggages; I didn't have the strength to move around with them. So from Chicago, I booked a room at hotel as I knew it would only take me 5 min to get to the front desk from the moment I collect my luggage. It was around 8pm, I was tired, I collected my luggage, got to the front desk, the check-in was very expedite with a friendly staff who welcomed me with a warm smile. A concierge asked me he can bring my luggage up for me, I got to my room, and 5 min later my luggages were there. I thanked him with a tip and I just threw myself into the bed! I booked a standard queen room. It wasn't large, but I wasn't looking for space. The bed was comfortable enough for my sleep, and I had space in the open closet for my stuff. The bathroom was a regular one, nothing really fancy or modern, just organized, clean with all the amenities, particularly the towels that are nicely arranged for guests. I had everything I needed for my night and went straight to bed. Despite the very proximity of the hotel with runways, the rooms are very quiet and you are not disturbed by any kind of noise from planes landing or taking off. Additionally, as a bonus to hotel guests, they also have those coupons in each room that give you discounts on most shops in the terminal...very useful when planning to do some shopping or just to have a drink in the terminal. As I needed to rent a car to hit the road, this hotel happens to be very convenient, as all I needed to do and go down, get out the hotel, and the rental shuttle bus was right there. Once I got the car, I came back to the hotel to collect my luggage. And because I got there after 12pm, time of check-out, I knew the room key wouldn't work anymore, so I asked at the front desk and they assisted me immediately. They also kept one of my luggages when I was putting others in the car. Overall great experience as usual and I will not hesitate to go back this hotel every time I need to. The room could be a bit pricy sometimes, but when you get a good deal, it's worth it! I rated this hotel 4 star more because of the convenient location and the hassle free that it provides.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our purpose to our satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: summer789
Reviews.Content: We overnighted here because we had to make an early morning connection and also because our inbound flight was late in arriving, about 11.30pm the night prior. Hence the convenience of staying in a hotel located at the airport was ideal. In addition, we were able to do our bookings online and although we arrived so late there was no delay in checking us in. We booked a standard, non-smoking room with king bed. Room was fairly small but very adequate for our needs. Bed was very comfortable, room clean. Coffeemaker, wi-fi,A/C, shampoo,soap,body lotion provided. Adequate lighting, comfortable armchair. Laundry service available. Noted,however, was able to hear planes landing and taking off at times and the sound of the plumbing in the room above. Other than that was quite happy with the choice and would stay there again given the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Austini
Reviews.Content: The good: The location (the hotel is essentially part of the Miami airport's Concourse D) was very handy for getting up in the morning and catching our flight. The rooms are quite soundproofed from outside noise â€” notably planes taking off â€” although not so soundproofed from noisy guests in the hallways. The hotel restaurant ("Top of the Port") was surprisingly good, if perhaps a hair overpriced. We were traveling with a group of friends who had children, and the kids loved watching the airplanes from the restaurant. The restaurant staff was also very nice and helpful. The not-so-good: We got one of the "Queen Rooms," which was exceedingly small. It was so small that we had a hard time figuring out where to put our luggage on the floor (there was no closet or any sort of stand to place luggage on) where we'd still be able to walk around the bed and get to the bathroom. We called down to the desk to ask for a folding luggage rack (figuring we could put one suitcase on top of the rack and slide a smaller one underneath it), but the front desk not only told us the hotel had no luggage racks, they actually seemed puzzled about what a luggage rack even was (a quite bit of the staff doesn't seem to have English as their first language, which is probably a great help for many international travelers staying at this hotel, but it caused some minor, occasional confusion with us). On the other hand, the friend we were traveling with had a pricier "Standard Room," and it was, in fact, a perfectly standard-sized, well-appointed hotel room with plenty of space. (When they later saw our "Queen" room, they literally burst out in laughter at its tiny size.) The fairly bad: Checking into the airport proved to be a lot of hassle, since we wanted to unload our rental car at the hotel and check in, then return the rental car. But because of airport security regulations, there's absolutely nowhere to leave a car unattended for even a couple of minutes at the hotel entrance. We were required to return the rental car first, and then schlep back to the hotel, hauling all our luggage, via the rental car shuttle bus. This hotel is totally geared to air travelers; scratch it completely off your list if you're trav eling by car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: timbolester
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading some of the previous reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised upon check in. The front desk agent told me she was upgrading us. We were on the top floor (room 739 - directly across from the Presidential Suite). The room was modern, clean and very fresh-feeling. It was a King room and was very spacious. We heard absolutely NO noise from the outside; just the normal "hallway sounds" one would hear in any hotel. We didn't hear or see any sounds or sights of ongoing renovation. Perhaps they are finished, or it is on another floor. Since we were only there for one night, to catch an early flight out of MIA, we didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked very nice. It was also on the same floor as our room. Based upon this one-night experience, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very kind and extremely professional”
Reviews.Author: cajunj
Reviews.Content: My connecting flight was cancelled and the airlines issued a voucher for me to stay overnight. The rooms were extremely clean and the staff was very helpful. The next day I left in a hurry to insure that I caught my flight to get home. I left my wedding ring in the room and when I called the hotel to see if it had been turned in I did'nt expect to hear good news. The houskeeper had found my ring and turned it in. It is so nice to know there are still good honest people in this world. God bless her and the wonderful staff. She is truly a saint!

Reviews.Title: “STRANGE”
Reviews.Author: Houseofcardsathome
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it was just the room we had but it did NOT have any windows. WEIRD. Standard travellers no frills place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Having second thoughts”
Reviews.Author: gcubed723
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for the past 10 years on my way to the Keys to Dive. I've never thought it was excellent, but it's always been ok to spend on night. It's convenient since I pick up a rental car the next morning, grab my buddy that comes in from DFW on the 9:30am flight and we're off. I've been through the renovation (is that still going on) and it has been a mess for more than one of my visits, and the Staff is not always friendly. I can't imagine how ratings in April and May of 2011 can very from 1 to 5. Guess I'll take a chance and stay there again in July..p.s. has the pool ever opened?

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: PartainTA
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are rude, inconsistent and do not provide any type of service remotely close to acceptable or adequate. The hotel is dirty and out dated, the rooms were awful and the beds hard. I couldnâ€™t help but envision bed bugs scurrying around all night while I slept in this antiquated hotel. It was an absolutely miserable experience. I would never stay at this hotel again and would go out of my wayâ€”significantly if necessaryâ€”to stay anywhere else. The convenience of the property at the airport is does not, in any way, make up for how awful this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Only because I had to”
Reviews.Author: Luke1285
Reviews.Content: My flight was canceled and was rescheduled for early the next morning. After almost 20 hours flying (from Australia then LAX), I needed somewhere close by so I could get some sleep before my flight and not have to rush back to the airport. The room was very barebones, nowhere to sit other than on the bed and no bar fridge. There was a large gap under the door so the light was shining underneath but was easily remedied by placing a towel in front of it. The noise of other people showering/water going down pipes was considerably louder than other hotels I've stayed at. The bathroom was nice and clean however, and the towels/sheets were comfortable. Checking out the woman at the desk was quite rude, barely saying a word to me and more or less thrusting my receipt at me. I would only stay here if absolutely necessary. The concierge was helpful, but I was pretty soured by the woman when I was checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you need a place to crash!”
Reviews.Author: business_travel81
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel because it was the place our company help a one day Board meeting. I had reserved a room with one king bed but when I arrived to my room it was a room with 2 doubles. Next thing I noticed was the room wasn't very clean with debri around the edges and very noticeable dust on the AC vent. Then off to the bathroom to find a broken sink faucet (photo attached). This made it hard to turn on the water. When I informed the front desk they said the engineer would take care of it but didn't seem apologetic at all. After stepping out for dinner I returned to the hotel around 10:45pm. I met some of my colleagues, who ate at the Top of the Port Restaurant, and the gentleman working said it was ok to move our conversation to the waiting area of the restaurant. Well he was done working at 11PM and about 11:15PM another staff member of the hotel came and said we couldn't sit there and needed to go back to our room or leave the hotel. Well I went back to my room and realized the broken faucet was never fixed but it was too late to say anything else. One of the only good things about the room was it was totally sound proof and the bed was comfortable. The other good thing about this hotel was the location at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and ugly”
Reviews.Author: Ana34439
Reviews.Content: Ugly, outdated, needs renovation urgently! Unkept, unsafe! Black hairs on the pillow and the towels, earrings on the floor, no sign of good thorough clening....Having no other choice of hotel at the airport is no excuse for the administration to have such a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for those needs a night sleep while waits flight time”
Reviews.Author: mauro1980
Reviews.Content: Great location with attratives rates. I was with my wife and 1 year daughter coming from Orlando and looking for a hotel til the take off (6 hours waiting time), and we found this hotel inside the airport with great rates (US$ 129.00 plus taxes) They provided a baby bed as I wish. Pros - Great location (inside the airport) - Good rates about the location - Concierge - Great staff Cons - No internet access (you need pay for the airport internet - US$ 4,95 for 30 minutes) - The door was with trouble to lock from outside. I needed a "strong pull" to lock - Small room with 2 beds - No refrigerator in the room

Reviews.Title: “sux”
Reviews.Author: ccpin
Reviews.Content: Horrible is the only word to discribe this hole ! Woke up at 3:00 in the morning to water dripping only to find out that the ceiling tile had fallen and the water from the pipes was leaking all over the bed. They knew there was a problem with the pipes way prior to our stay because there was a damn foil roasting pan up in the ceiling to catch the water . lol We were then given a wonderful smoking room , near a stair case and door. Doors banged all night and the room smelt like sh*( . Went up to the room and took pictures of the hole in the ceiling and roaster at 6:00 in the morning , which I can post if someone wants to see them. And to top it all off not even a discount or money refunded from either the dive, or expedia (who we will never trust again) after we complained. There are plenty of nice hotels in Miami, I suggest getting a cab and go find one .

Reviews.Title: “Grab a Taxi and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Coco1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the Miami airport, but if you don't know how to get around the airport or only speak english good luck finding this place. There is really no signs in the airport fo rthis hotel, and anyone you ask seems to send you in a different direction. When I finally found this place it was late, and front desk staff weren't very friendly. There hotel is run down and old, but do have comfortable beds, and hot showers. The next morning staff were no better, and I felt bad for bothering them to check out. I would leave the airport next time a grab another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfy and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl215
Reviews.Content: Our team of 25 stayed at this hotel, mainly for the convenience since we had an early morning flight the next morning. I am a very picky person when it comes to cleanliness and my experience at this hotel was good. The rooms were clean, customer service was ok, and I thought the bed was comfortable, which doesn't happen very often for me. Elevator was slow, so we a couple of times we took the stairs. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bobbk76
Reviews.Content: Never trust the website pictures! Whilst this hotel is convenient being at the airport, I wish I had paid extra in time and money to go out of the airport. We were on our honeymoon and therefore I asked for a bottle of champagne to be in our room when we arrived. Nothing! When I mentioned it to reception they just shrugged and did not even apologise, despite admitting it was on my booking form! The setting is grim being in Miami airport, the views well of buildings! But I suppose we would not have expected anything else. The rooms plain, dated and uncomfortable. Not the place to relax in between flights. As for the food, I think you are better going to Subway than eating there. Tasteless huge portions that cost far too much. Don't bother with wine as it is overpriced. Worst value I have ever had and not the way I wanted to start married life. The staff very unhelpful and slow. Been a while but definately no tipping here. My only tip was don't ever stay.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sillyrabbit1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Feb 16, 2011 in room 528 and midway through the next day realized I had 13 bed bug bites on my hand, arm, torso and shoulder. Stay away from here at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “small room, terrible bathrooms but convenient”
Reviews.Author: zimbotraveler
Reviews.Content: We flew into Miami and needed a place to stay before we left for the Bahamas the following day. The room was so small and the water went hot to cold then back to hot during the shower. The toilet flushed and would not stop flushing until I tinkered with the handle. It was very convenient but that is the only thing I can say about the hotel. We ordered room service and my chicken sandwich was inedible but my boyfriends club sandwich was decent and the chicken wings were good. We thought about getting a movie but it was $19.99 to watch Inception. I thought the hotel was a rip off and needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the convenience and a GOOD night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: BronxTraveleer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is INSIDE of the airport and couldn't be more convenient for a quick overnight. The hotel appears to be recently updated with new fixtures but since the bathroom faucet bangs into the shelf it is clear the updates were not well planned. Surprisingly the bed was super comfortable. We got 4 hours of sleep and felt refreshed! Don't be scared off by the airport customers sleeping in the lobby - I was impressed the hotel was gracious enough to allow people to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, run-down and unsafe”
Reviews.Author: MarciLW
Reviews.Content: Came here after a cruise because we had an early flight the next day. Run-down, carpets & bathroom filthy, anybody in the airport has access to the hotel elevators, view of the service shaft through the window, no fan in the bathroom, broken shower head. Bed totally uncomfortable - sheets felt like plastic. A total ripoff for the price. Only reason to stay here is that it is at the airport. Pay the extra $$ for a cab to the airport. Worst hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location”
Reviews.Author: Naphiyl
Reviews.Content: Safe, reasonably clean and right where you need to be. Don't expect much more. You can carry your own bags, stand and wait for employees to let you pass (carrying your own bags) and generally prepare for what the TSA will do for you later.

Reviews.Title: “Skip MIA hotel in the airport”
Reviews.Author: bobisname
Reviews.Content: I'll skip the unfriendly staff discussion and move to a couple of concrete points. First, if you have a room near the elevators, you get to hear "dinging" all night as late night arrivals show up from other flights. In the rooms they post a "40% markup on AT&T calls made from the room." Given that AT&T's rates are 6 cents a minute, no big deal, right? Wrong. SInce their answering machine did not work (and they treated me like it was my problem) I had to make a call. At $4 a minute it really adds up. I'm not great at math, but that is a lot more of a % markup than advertised in print. When I asked about their signage being flat out wrong, they refused to discuss that but told me I could have gone to a pay phone instead. Thanks. Most importantly, when you cancel a reservation two days in advance, IN PERSON at the desk, I was still charged as a no show. Write a letter? Don't bother, they don't respond. Or correct the error. I'll go elsewhere next time I fly through MIA!

Reviews.Title: “Room 348 - sagging mattresses and view of an airshaft wall”
Reviews.Author: highlandbride
Reviews.Content: MIA hotel is great because it is connected to MIA airport, but features faded third-world glamour. Marble bathroom featured drain stoppers that didn't work, or had to be pulled out by hand and peeling of porcelain re-coat in bathtub. Mattresses have seen a lot of action - very soft and sheets are OK, kind of scratchy. The duvet on bed was suitable for below zero climate - had to pull it off completely. Toiletries are minimal - bring your own. Room was tiny but for a 9 hour stay, tolerable. Hotel staff was pleasant and tried hard - brought up toothbrushes we didn't have due to lost luggage, and the bartender was kind to extend last call as she was in a hurry to leave to go to a party elsewhere. So long as you are staying on travel industry discount or room voucher from airline (we were, we missed a connecting flight due to mechanical problems), it will do for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones but convenient”
