Reviews.Author: cpearl
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight out of MIA and wanted the convience of being right in the airport. The room was very tiny, just enough room for a double bed pushed up against the wall, and a chair and a tv. The washroom was marble and clean. The windows do not have curtains, just wooden shutters and the window latch was broken, so it did not close properly. The whole place has a well worn feeling and there is a strong and pervasive smell of disinfectant/air freshener like everything has been soaked in febreeze, very headache inducing! I think is was overpriced for what we got, but not grossly horrible either.

Reviews.Title: “only thing good was the location”
Reviews.Author: MROSS79104
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was filthy, carpet is just glued on squares, I was itching the next morning, think it had bed bugs. The toilet keep running after you flushed it, you had to really hit the handle hard for it to stop. Very loud in the hallways at night. Bath tub was not cleaned. Had lots of pillows though. Front desk was ok. Would I stay there again, maybe if I had a really early flight, I thought it was way over priced for what you get, the room was really small. They got you there cause of the location, why should they care about my issues. No reason to go back unless it's an emergency

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully convenient to break up long trips!!!”
Reviews.Author: bandbshow
Reviews.Content: Flying home from Brazil, we were so happy to have a place to sleep before the rest of our leg home to San Diego. This hotel is very convenient , but no frills. The people were really helpful in person and on the phone. The staff in the bar/restaurant next to the lobby were really nice as well. There is a restaurant on the roof, but we were too tired to have a full sit down dinner. The rooms are sound proof to ensure a good night sleep- it sure beats sleeping in those uncomfortable chairs in the airport terminal!!! It is right in the terminal, so it makes for easy check in and check out- especially if you have an early morning flight!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for day rate”
Reviews.Author: fbrusca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise. The cruise ended at 7 am and our flight home wasn't until 6 pm. This hotel offers a nice day rate (10 am to 5 pm). The bed was delicious and the room was very quiet. Perfect for a mid-day nap. The only downside was that the room was tiny. Also, the front desk guy seemed irritated that we wanted to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: evanz14
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled so we stayed here overnight. We were tired and relieved to find a hotel actually in the airport but did have trouble locating it and had to ask for directions. The airline provided us with a "distressed traveller's rate voucher" for the hotel for which we were thankful. It was very convenient to for our early departure the next morning and we were happy with the room as it was clean and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel - but clean and not as bad as some say.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeaucoup
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay in you've just arrived at MIA, or have an early morning flight. It is clean, but a very tired hotel. Needs a giant facelift. But then the prices will surely go up. The hotel is not signposted from other terminals. When you get to Terminal E, there is one sign indicating where it is. But even in the elevator, there is no sign. Sorry, but I can't remember which floor - but there's only a choice on 2 others. The check in girl was pleasant enough, but at 1 in the morning, the place feels a bit spooky. It is not "The Shining", but my wife was pleased I was there too. The room was small. Ditto the bed. There was too much furniture for a small room. TV worked OK - local channels were free. Even got BBC news (but not in the morning). Movies and premium channels were available at a cost. The bathroom was also small and tired. But a rain shower had been bolted on to the old shower head. It looked a bit naff, but it worked well. The towels were arranged in a 5-star hotel style - the management are trying hard to dress this mutton as a lamb. Good on 'em for trying. The inside shutters were closed, and in the morning we discovered the well-sound-proofed window overlooked a roof. No view. But we were at the end of the corridor, so other rooms may have been better. WiFi was provided by someone else, so it was not free. (Pet hate of all hotels that don't provide free wifi.) We asked if we could check out late if need be - no problem. The "new" car rental centre is excellent at MIA. Frequent shuttle buses (soon to be replaced by train) take you to a purpose built building 5 mins away where all car rental companies are housed. A sensible move.

Reviews.Title: “Horendous”
Reviews.Author: phcfinancial
Reviews.Content: Shower valve did not work. When we complained, they gave us no satisfaction. They wouldn't give any kind of rebate because we had reserved it through Orbitz. The room was so small you had to walk sideways to get by the foot of the bed to get to the bathroom. The room was dark and dingy . Don't stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably quiet & dark.”
Reviews.Author: Bay6601
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after flying in to Miami from Australia - with layovers for connecting flights some 24 hrs after we left our home. Finding the hotel was easy and we were grateful not to have to shuttle bus off the terminal to an "airport hotel" - when this one was in the terminal! After a quick bite in one of the terminal fast food joints we fell asleep at around 10pm. I am quite a light sleeper and did not hear any planes landing or taking off through the night and awoke the next morning around 8am but thinking it was still early as the room was so dark. A really great place to catch up on the zzzz's before or after a flight. The room was spacious and the bathroom was fine for a good shower before heading off to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: sazzijo
Reviews.Content: We got in very late and were able to get a room with two beds, non smoking. The beds were very comfortble, the unit was clean and very modern (nice rainhead shower!) but small, but we were just catching a few hours of sleep between flights so that was no problem. I had booked the room on Priceline, but thought our flight into Miami was going to be cancelled due to tropical storms, so I cancelled our reservation that day. We made it in afterall and the price at the front desk when we checked in was $20.00 less than our Priceline.com price. Very convenient if you need a place to stay between flights, but kind of tricky to find in the airport, not well marked.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: MJT66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the comviemance of an early morning flight. Had to change rooms to to the nasty smell, the second room was not better. Hotel staff at the front desk were not very friendly- Housekeeping brought spray to the room, the helped for about ten minutes.... Altough you cannot hear the airplanes, hotel doors closing all night had kept us awake- Bathroom was disgustingly dirty and small. Requested an iron, unfortunately the iroming board was filthy and the iron leaked all over, could not iron any clothes. Would never ever stay hear again!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: KatoJen
Reviews.Content: We had booked one night at the Miami International Airport Hotel because our flight came in around midnight and we did not want to have to deal with transportation at that time of night, plus we were flying out again the next morning and the location of this hotel made sense. We figured because the room cost about $125 it should be pretty decent. The hotel is pretty dated but really who cares as long as its clean. On our first stay I would rate the room as fairly clean. The linen on the beds seemed fresh. I was disappointed there is a fee for the wi-fi access - I must have read the room amenities wrong on the Hotels.ca site and thought it would be free. Anyhow if it weren't for the location we would not have considered staying here a second time. A week later we had to stay one night in Miami again so we booked the hotel again only because of the location and the late arrival of our flight. I guess our luck had run out! On our second one night stay the room was not clean. There were two double beds and one of them looked as if it had been slept in, the sheets on one side were very wrinkled as was the mattress cover under the sheet. There were hairs in the bed and on the pillows. The blanket on top of the sheet and under the bedspread had a white crunchy substance on............ disgusting! The t.v. remote also had some unknown white dried substance between the number buttons....... We decided not to complain as it was after midnight and one of the beds seemed clean so we shared it. The next morning when having a shower I saw that I was sharing the shower with a curtain that had what appeared to be mold or snot on it.... The floor in the bathroom also had hair on it (not ours) - as if had not been cleaned after the last travelers. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. The staff at the front desk seemed okay but we did not make a fuss. We did sleep well knowing we would not have to deal with transportation before our flight the next day - but to be honest I did wonder what the CSI blue light would show on the bed we were sleeping in... sometimes its just better not to know. A few days later, at the end of our trip we again had a one night stay in Miami before flying out and we did not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and thats about it”
Reviews.Author: TampaChristopher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a year ago on the way to the caribbean - the only positive thing I can say is that it is convenient for layovers. Room was dirty and the hotel is way overdue for renovation. Very outdated. I remember the price being ok but not what I would call a good value. I would suggest trying one of the other hotels nearby that offer free shuttle service to the airport. Thats what we plan to do later this year when going to caribbean again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Journeynevis
Reviews.Content: Stay here for the convenience but don't expect great service. After 11 pm its Subway or no way. There is no bar, restaurant or room service after 11 pm. Their web page advertises internet access but I stayed in a "studio" apt which is also not advertised - and I could not hold a signal. When I asked the "Front Desk" about my internet access, he said it belongs to the airport not to the hotel. He gave me a help number but I was so frustrated I went to the lobby to sign on. Great for convenience and sleep. If you get in before the restaurant and bar close, better yet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable room - what more could you need before an early start?”
Reviews.Author: DJHunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location in the airport cut out all the hassles of early morning taxis and traffic. The room was comfortable and clean and the staff very efficient and helpful when we needed guidance before heading into South Beach for the day. The food from room service wasn't cheap but was prompt and very good. And we got an excellent rate booking in advance. Only minor snag was the lack of plug points anywhere near any mirrors. I will definitely use the hotel again if I am in transit through Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A sad little hotel”
Reviews.Author: r747
Reviews.Content: The convenience of this hotel right on Concourse E of MIA is obvious but that convenience is exploited to the full in the high cost of a very inferior product. The place at least a decade overdue for a serious makeover. Our room was adequate in size for an overnight, but very unfortunately reeked of unwashed bodies and feet. I suspect the window had not been opened for years and the aircon. was unable to remedy that situation even after 12 hours. The washbasin plug was broken/disconnected and therefore water had to be run continuously when trying to wash. I could go but suffice it to say that unless you are arriving and departing from Terminal E, save yourself a long walk, get a taxi to another hotel and save yourself some money.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: cookieitaly
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night in february having a very early morning flight.Hotel ok just for a short layover;room prices high but the location is very convenient.I will stay here again only in case any other early morning flight

Reviews.Title: “Convienent Location - Not the Horror show that Was Expectec”
Reviews.Author: foodisourpassion
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews regarding this hotel, we booked a room with great trepidation. However having a very early morning departure and previously experiencing the poor shuttle service to nearby hotels we decided to roll the dice. We actually were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the room. We checked sheets and bathroom and found no issues. The rooms are small, 10 foot wide; noise from the airport is minimized, but other guests slamming doors in the hallway can be disturbing. Overall if we had an early morning flight we would stat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Filthy Filthy”
Reviews.Author: DesertChill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight because of convenience. First thing you notice coming in the room is the lack of a desk chair. You have to use an ottoman for a chair which means you sit so low that desk top comes to just below your shoulders. The furniture had a thick layer of dust and the carpet looked like it hasnt been vacummed in a while. The door to the bathroom has an auto shut feature so the door remains closed which makes it a bit uncomfortable as the bathroom is tiny and dirty. The bowl of the toilet had hair and dirt clinging to it as well as the outside of the tub. The bottom of the shower curtain was black and had yellow stains all over it. The sink had hair and some dark yellow residue that that I wiped clean with a tissue. In the morning after taking a shower, the steam made it apparent how filthy the mirror was. The marble floor had dirt stains and probably hasnt been mopped in some time. The doors and door jambs were grimey. I couldnt wait to get out of this room. Next time I lay over in Miami I will stay somewhere else. The room conditions are not worth the convenience of location.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!”
Reviews.Author: fpoetter
Reviews.Content: Dear fellow travelers, I got stuck at Miami International Airport just last night and was put into this hotel by my airline. I have seen a lot but this is definitely one of the worst places I have ever stayed. The rooms are really small, the whole place is smelly and kind of dirty. After checking in I went up to the 7th floor as my airline had provided a voucher for dinner. The food is disgusting - I had ordered salmon. I got it half cooked with almost not-cooked veggies. Back at my room I went to the bathroom and found that there was a lot of black hair in the bathtub (mine is short and brown). I called the reception but they never showed up. I woke up around 10 times that night because the beds are right next to the doors in those tiny little rooms and you hear every door slam in the long hallway. The night finally ended at 4:30 AM (!!!!!!!) because housekeeping was vacuuming the hallway - as I would call it in the middle of the night. This is really really not to be recommended. It is dirty, shabby, noisy and the staff are unfriendly in an unequaled way! STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL - TAKE THE MONEY AND SLEEP IN THE TERMINAL BUILDING. YOUR NIGHT THERE WILL BE BETTER THINE MINE WAS SLEEPING IN THIS DUMP OF A HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel we ever stayed at !”
Reviews.Author: cuspids
Reviews.Content: Stayed there because we felt it would work better for us with little children. Front desk didn't really give a toss at all. First room we were given, there was no telephone service and alarm clock broken. I went to front desk and they said they would call maintenance. One hour later I returned and demanded another room. They gave me another. In that room the shower didn't work, the drain in the bath wouldn't work. The room was poorly renovated with holes and paint peeling. My daughter got bed bug bites. Felt like a prison room. When we informed front desk the next morning, they just said they would tell maintenance. THIS IS AN EMBARRASSMENT for MIA ! Will NEVER STAY AGAIN! THIS IS A 1 STAR HOTEL !

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SightsAndSoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Miami Airport International Hotel in Jan 2009 and in Jan 2010, and find it comfortable and convenient. The cost of the hotel is related to its location, not standard. The bathrooms are modern, the rooms small but quiet and comfortable, the beds are super comfortable and the wooden shutters block any undesireable view that they may overlook. The avvertised Wi-Fi did not work and the restaurant on the 7th floor is overpriced, but still a better option than fast food joints in the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Key card Snafu”
Reviews.Author: NorcalSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a one nite stay prior to a cruise. First room assigned , I had to go back to desk 3 times to get a new Key Card. Finally we were moved to a new room (new key card) that didn't work. Security finally had to let us in/out. Room very small. could not turn off fan all nite ...it was either freezing or hot. The peep hole in the door had been removed and replaced with tissue paper...The room was clean and the staff friendly, but I did not speak Spanish so communication was difficult. Yes, this is Miami but it is in the USA and someone there should be a little more fluent in English. At $150. per I would expect better. The only reason to stay here is it's location to Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: samstevens
Reviews.Content: The airline put me up here due to a missed flight......the choice was here or another hotel that required that I catch a shuttle bus. Since my flight was very early, I opted for this airport hotel. BIG mistake. The room was disgusting.......the nail clippings on the carpet kinda put it over the top! I would never stay here again......next time I will take the hotel that requires a shuttle ride no matter how early my flight is. Had I been paying for the room myself I would have been really upset. Of the multiple pillows on the bed.....only one of them did not have a dirty pillow case......avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you have less than a 12 hour layover”
Reviews.Author: Hoya86
Reviews.Content: You will pay anywhere from $30 to $50 more a night to stay at this hotel - the question is if it is worth it. If your flight is before 8am, or you have less than a 12 hour layover, consider this hotel. The rooms are very small, as mentioned before, ours didnt have a closet. Aside from that, the lobby opens right onto the terminal - you can walk less than 30 yards to a Starbucks, Burger King, California Pizza Kitchen/food court. After exiting customs, take the elevator straight up stairs one level and you will have less than a five minute walk with your baggage cart. However once you get to the hotel, baggage carts are not allowed in the elevators - assuming the bell man (who wants a tip) catches you. On the way out, bellman will bring your suitcases downstairs, but wont take them to the airline check in. In terms of noise - we heard no airplane noise - we were facing the parking garage. So, would I recommend this hotel? Only if you have a short layover, an early departure, and you plan to spend very minimal time in the room. If money is an issue, there are much better values off-airport, but you do have to go through the shuttle bus salsa to get there and back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced convenience for catching your flight”
Reviews.Author: BeachSeekerNewMexico
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean. We stayed at the hotel twice and it gave us the freedom to leave our bags in the room until the last minute, which was really nice. The hotel is located on Concourse 'E' which was very close to the security entrance for our American Airlines flight. To check your bag just hop into the nearby elevator, go up one level to the moving sidewalks and zip over to the kiosk. Then you can have breakfast at a nice place, or at the food court, freshen up and check out with your carry-on bags. What's not so nice is the temperature controls in the room. They just have the old style plastic lever with no numbers, so when the maid cleans the room and turns it down to max cool, it takes some time to get it set. They need to upgrade to digital. Then there was the 11PM fire alarm with the automated voice to "evacuate the hotel". The desk told us someone opened an emergency exit at the pool, which I still don't understand the logic in making that a reason to trip a full alarm. Hope that doesn't happen often. I would only recommend this hotel for those with little time in Miami that want to trade the time to deal with cabs and shuttles for some rest

Reviews.Title: “Three best things about MIA hotel? Location, location, and location.”
Reviews.Author: RCKKMK
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews, I was skeptical but ended up booking here anyway. I'm writing from the room right now, in fact. Yes, it's old. Yes, it's dingy (not really dirty, but dingy). Yes, the rooms are tiny (mine doesn't have an office chair by the desk -- it has an ottoman to sit on!) But when you have a flight that boards at 6:30, you can put up with these things. I parked in short-term parking and took most of my luggage in. Checked in, and had one difficulty... The door of the room they gave me was propped open with the lock; when nobody answered my knock, I went in to find the toilet running like crazy and water on the floor. So I called down to the front desk and they switched me to another room. I went out for a nice Cuban dinner and returned the rental car, took the Hertz shuttle with just one over-the-shoulder bag, and came upstairs. Tomorrow morning, I will gladly forgive the dark and tiny room as I'm thinking about **NOT** driving in from the Embassy Suites, **NOT** returning my rental car, **NOT** taking a month's worth of suitcases on the shuttlebus, etc. Just as in real estate, the three most important things are location, location, and location. Whatever faults it has, this hotel does indeed have a good location. One important warning if you stay here... Wifi is at a cost (except for this season, when Google is providing it throughout MIA for free). Worse, the "Internet stations" in the business center charge $.25 per minute and $.50 per PAGE of printing. Pay attention to the $5 minimum charge; had I seen it, I might have walked over and gotten a boarding pass from the airline counter -- more to protest the charge than to save the money!

Reviews.Title: “old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: ima65
Reviews.Content: this place is old and all run down. looks like the 1960,s ! paint peeeling from the walls ! old dirty tile ! its a dump !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC EXPERIENCE ALL AROUND”
Reviews.Author: katiemacla
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of a long trip for an overnight layover. We walked up to the front desk and were given a lower than posted on the internet rate and superior service from check in to check out. We had dinner on the 7th floor with top notch service from an A+ server and were served a wonderful meal. Our room was clean, well-appointed and exactly what we needed, having arrived exhausted and in desperate need of a good nights' sleep. The bed was heavenly. If you are stuck in MIA and looking for an affordable, comfortable option for a long layover or overnight stay, I would - without exception- recommend this hotel. A fabulous way to end a fabulous vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient; would do it again.”
Reviews.Author: Zoeycat
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the MIAH, both times for overnight layovers. So convenient, especially if you're getting in late and leaving early. You walk out the hotel door and you're looking at the ticket counters! Again we found the front-desk people to be friendly and efficient. The elevators, hallways, and rooms were spotless. Yes the rooms are quite small but all we were after was a comfy bed and a clean bathroom. Amazing that you can't hear the airplanes at all, but every time someone closes their door it echoes down the hall -- bring your earplugs. This really isn't out-of-the-ordinary for hotels, tho. What I did find strange (and if I hadn't stayed here once before without a glitch this might have put me off staying here again) was the sheets! The bottom sheet was fine but the top sheet was like a very thick piece of paper! It actually crackled like paper. Never seen anything like it, ever... and we've stayed in a gazillion hotels/resorts. When you rolled over, the sheet stayed where you were -- tented like you were still there. They were noisy, uncomfortable and certainly not warm as they wouldn't lay over your body. Strange. Hubby and I finally got up and turned everything over, so the blanket was next to our skin and the sheet on the outside. That solved the problem. I'm sure we'd give them another chance, but here's a hint, MIAH....FABRIC SOFTENER! Gallons of it........

Reviews.Title: “nice place but taking too long to renovate”
Reviews.Author: AutumnBreeze911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this same hotel June 1, 2008 and it was much easier to locate the lobby this time. The rooms are small but clean. New tile. Big rain type shower head. Lots of pillows on the bed. No issues at check in nor check out. Decent price when you book well in advance. We only had 2 issues. Number one my family and I had picked up a snack and drink in the airport and wanted to sit in the bar right next to the lobby and visit while enjoying our coffee and soft drink since we were all staying in different rooms but even though we were all registered guest of the hotel and only a couple people were in the bar that early in the afternoon the lady on duty made us leave and sit elsewhere. Number two issue is it was very hot and my daughter wanted to go swimming but the pool area is still being renovated. I don't know when those renovations started but when I booked this hotel for the June 2008 trip I booked it several months prior to that trip and they had already started the renovations then and we are now September 2009 and they are STILL working on the pool. Ok folks it's cement, a filter pump, and water......... it can't be taking that long. Other than these two things it is a nice place and I would recommend it. Great for very early or late arriving flights.

Reviews.Title: “meh...it is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: glimmerLA
Reviews.Content: my bf and i stayed here during an overnight layover. obviously, it's geared for convenience and nothing else, which is exactly what we needed. i didn't expect anything else other than a clean room to rest my eyes during an 8 hour overnight layover. the room was small - fine. nothing special - fine. cockroaches?!?! - not fine! as we were getting ready to check out in the morning, my bf found a visitor crawling about. ew. i mean, i definitely appreciate the convenience of the airport hotel and would stay there again under the same circumstances, but preferably sans roach. oh, also, the entire lobby and parts of the hallway are made entirely of super reflective chrome so it's a little retro-fabulous and dizzifying.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful, Matchbox Sized Room”
Reviews.Author: nickyinja
Reviews.Content: Even though I was not expecting a 5 star hotel. It was awful. I could not be paid to stay there again. The next time I travel and have to stay overnight, I'll definitely stay at another hotel and get a cab. It was not worth the convenience of having the airport a a couple floors down, believe me. When I first set foot in the room, I thought to myself where is the rest of it? My husband and I could barely navigate the space in the room. Dingy is the word I used to describe it to my friends. The sheets did not look clean and neither did the room, it was so bad I almost felt like taking a shower with my slippers on so my feet wouldnt touch the shower floor. I really didnt like it and that's my review.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk personnel extremely helpful.”
Reviews.Author: mishinoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were passing through Florida on my way to my daughter's wedding in Canada. We cannot tolerate the long wait in the lobby for a connecting flight so we always stay at the hotel and fly out early the next morning. Everything went well going to Canada. However, coming back was horrible for us. I had left my wallet with my money in it and my husband only had his credit card, which I had used in Canada and had very little money left on it. I explained my situation to Roland and that I had some cash and the credit card and to see if he could find me a good deal on a room for two senior citizens. He did! What I really liked about him was that he was patient and courteous even though I was a nervous nellie. I did not get an opportunity to fill our the card, but I wanted to say how much I appreciated his kindness and professional manner in dealing with my situation. I intend to stay there whenever I'm passing through Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Like Motel 6 but over priced”
Reviews.Author: yenger
Reviews.Content: The convenience of this hotel being in an airpot is great if you have an early flight, but the price for the room is ridiculous!!! $100 a night for a room that smells like a Goodwill or wet carpet is really not worth it. If you've ever been to Japan and have experience the whole hotel feel there then you'll understand what I'm talking about. This place is a dorm room and a tiny Japanese room but into one, but there's also a sleezy feeling to the whole hotel. Guest are loud and rude when leaving and leftover trays from room service sits in the hallway for who knows how long. Dining up on the 7th floor wasn't that bad, it was decent, but a little over priced. If you have an early flight like say, 6am, this is doable, but if you can just book elsewhere and do a cab then do a cab. Remember the MIA is a horrible airport, the earlier the better.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: letstravelwithtwins
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just outside security and actually CONNECTED TO TERMINAL. The rooms were comfortable and best of all virtually soundproof. There was some sort of double paned glass to cut out most of the jet noise. It was not the cheapest place to stay but very convenient. Breakfast at the restaurant on the top floor next morning was disappointing though. Extremely pricey and poor service. We finally got up and poured our own cup of coffee from the servers area!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Layovers”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel because of an overnight layover from Brazil. It could not be more convenient, located right next to the American Airlines check-in desk. It was really great not to have to drive, or even catch a shuttle, to the airport. We got to our room at about 6:00 p.m. and wanted to go outside of the airport for dinner. We caught a cab to Catch of the Day, about a mile away, and really liked the place. It's about a $10 cab ride each way. The food is very good and they often have live bands after 9:00 p.m. That way, we got a little taste of Miami even though we were staying at the airport. The rooms at the hotel are small but serviceable, a little beat up, it is true, but who cares for one night. I noticed they had a laundry, which might be nice for people with kids. We had a drink at the bar upstairs from the hotel, which was okay but nothing special. Overall, a good experience, and we will certainly stay there again. Be sure to get a good deal, though, it isn't worth a ton of money and pays to shop around for rates. I certainly wouldn't pay over $120 per night.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, but I woke up with bites!”
Reviews.Author: traveler132
Reviews.Content: I was stranded in Miami because of bad weather in Chicago. Since I wanted to stand by for the first flight in the morning, the airport hotel was a logical choice. The rate was actuallly very reasonable -- $119 ($29 more than the distressed traveler voucher I could've used at the Sofitel. I wanted convenience.). The room was small, but since I was only there to sleep that wasn't a concern. The bed was fine -- I thought. I found three small bites on my arm the next morning and a total of five more on my arm and leg. I travel literally around the world for work and have stayed in rooms that barely have electricity - I don't expect luxury accommodations, but I do expect not to be bitten!

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient place to sleep. You pay A LOT for the convenience.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyShane
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are 100% correct, Convenient place to sleep and that was about it. The rooms have flight info on the TV which was handy, double or triple glazed windows so had no airport noise. Furnishings were worn table had a busted leg, room needed a really good clean. Bed was lumpy. Thank god for Jet Lag - didnt care about any of that because I needed to sleep. Ask for a room that doesnt have a connecting door to the room next door - unfortunately they weren't thinking when they put tiles on the floor on either side of connecting room door. Especially when people arrive and depart at odd hours and have excited kiddies with them. Very frosty reception at this hotel. Was pretty cool to look out of your window and see all the planes coming and going on the tarmac. Would recommend the hotel only if you had a really late flight in or really early flight out and just needed a bed. Otherwise I suggest you look at some of the hotels just outside the airport as they nearly all have free shuttles. The airport food court is just down stairs too (dont get too excited about that either)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, shake off the jet lag”
Reviews.Author: faderman
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed in this hotel, first time was 20 years ago its really handy for the Airport of course but is good for Miami and buses for hire cars etc I had room service for dinner as I was worn out, the swimming pool was closed so don't expect to have a dip. I was hoping to do this but was disappointed. the bar looked ok but I did'nt fancy it . I had breakfast there, nice but felt rushed as usual, why oh why as there was only another 4 people there !! sorry if your American but why does eating have to be a contest i how quick you can eat or a training course to become a fire fighter

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MizzouSar
Reviews.Content: The Miami International Airport Hotel is number one, convenient. If you have a longer layover, definitely shop around as it is overpriced. I was willing to pay the extra money to be able to walk off the plane and be in my hotel room within 5 minutes. (We arrived in Miami at midnight and were flying out very early the next morning.) It was clean, comfy and quiet but again over priced. As many others have posted before, definitely pack your carry-on luggage accordingly. Our checked luggage was checked all the way through to our next destination even though we had an overnight layover. I had read others post and still failed to remember tooth brushes! The hotel was courteous and had toothbrushes delivered to our door within a few minutes after check-in. Would stay again when it's a VERY short layover in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more convenient!”
Reviews.Author: ecclectic-eccentric
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Miami around 5pm and had an 8am flight the next day, so we couldn't see spending big money on a waterfront hotel and the cab fare both ways. The airport hotel was absolutely perfect for us! Reception was friendly and efficient, and our room was nicely appointed, comfortable and very clean. The hallways are a bit drab, but who cares? Not us. Our room was quite small, but for the two of us for one night, it wasn't uncomfortable in the least. If I had to find a complaint, it was that the bathroom door was "spring loaded" and would slam shut loudly if you didn't hold it until it closed...again, no big deal. Oh, one more compalint, all though it's not technically the hotel's fault. When we booked our room online, the site we used said that there is a pool/spa. I don't know whether it's being redone or if it's just closed permanently, but it wasn't open. We weren't majorly disappointed, but somewhat. We did a little "airport shopping" as we'd been traveling very no frills for over two weeks. I got my hair done at the shop beside the hotel, Hubby bought a "Cuban" shirt, and I picked up some cheap jewelry to liven up a simple dress, then we went out for an awesome meal at Catch of the Day just a couple minutes from the hotel, having gotten the excellent suggestion from a poster on the Tripadvisor Miami forum. It may have just been a layover, but we had a great time in Miami and will probably structure our trip similarly next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sandkwalsh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before reading the reviews.........then panicked. These reviews were awful, but since we had an early morning flight with a toddler, we decided to suck it up, keep our reservation - just for the sheer convenience of being at the airport without having to take a shuttle. I was stunned. The service was impeccable, the room impeccably clean, and the attitude of the staff was positive and accomodating. They really couldn't do enough for us. Now, we just had a middle of the road room - we are not the wealthy. They brought up a pack and play for our 2 year old, made it up with clean sheets right in front of me, and even left him his own soap and face cloth. It was so cute. Room services was fast and pleasant. Front desk was pleasant. The only downside was the room was small, but considering the convenience - I was A-OK with it. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those who need to be at the airport. You get what you expect to get.....expect the best!

Reviews.Title: “My Oh My!”
Reviews.Author: babedoll161
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Key West for 5 nights (our first vacation in 4 years without the kids). We were having to much fun and lost track of time. When we got to the airport we were 5 minutes too late to check in for the flight and could only get a flight out at 6am the next morning. We decided lets just suck it up get a hotel some beer a pizza and watch a movie. Well we got the room. $119. It was cute, modern, decent for price. when i went to the bathroom the door got stuck on the toilet. We went for the pizza came back to the hotel to order beer 5.95 per miller light! ugh. sucked it up. ordered a movie $15! ugh. sucked again. while watching the movie i started to hear clanging sounds which i thought were coming from outside the window and thought nothing of it. we were in the middle of the airport. well after the movie and beer i had to use the potty again. i walked in and stepped in feces. i freaked and thought my husband overflowed the toilet. we then established that neither one of us had taken a #2 in the toilet since we arrived. which meant that it was someone elses crap that i had stepped in. barf! i called the front desk to which they told me to stay there they were coming up. they sent a security guard to escort me to my new room and expected me to carry my luggage. not happening. while waiting for them to send a cart the maintenence man arrived and said we had just used too much TP. are you kidding me this was not my crap and not my TP. I was livid. I went down to the front desk to let them know how disgusted i was with how they brushed it off like "oh your fault" and the fact that someone elses dung was on MY FOOT. i got "sorry". at checkout the woman gives me my bill and says "are you the toilet lady"....uh yeah i am. "would you like me to take of $20"...i would like you to do more but do what you feel is right. so i got $20 for stepping in a stranger poo! thanks alot. I would never ever stay in this hell whole ever in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl247
Reviews.Content: We booked a day room here post cruise. While our brief encounter with the staff at the front desk was pleasant, the room was so horribly dingy, dirty, and smelly that my 9 year old daughter wouldn't even sit down. Someone gave another guest our same room and within minutes of being there the stranger unlocked and opened our door. I don't know who was more startled. We couldn't even stay there for a few hours. We forfeited our money (all except about $20 that they took off the bill) and checked into another airport hotel for the day.

Reviews.Title: “There is only one reason to stay here-”
Reviews.Author: lucydodd
Reviews.Content: Convenience. Period. If this hotel was anywhere but right in the airport terminal, it probably wouldn't exist. We stayed here twice, passing through Miami on either end of a trip to Belize. We arrived late in the evening, checked in, and found that both the restaurant and room service had closed early. The front desk had no explanation for this. There are very limited choices in the airport at that time of night, so we made do with vending machine cuisine. Lovely. The rooms are small and have been minimally updated. I do have to say that the beds are comfortable. The phones in the hotel would not phone "out", which was a major inconvenience along with the lack of food. On the way back, 3 weeks later, we were really not looking forward to staying here again, but due to the pure convenience of the location, we stuck with our reservation and did so. We arrived earlier and the restaurant was still open. The service was horrible, and the food was pretty marginal. All in all, if you have a very short turn around and need a bed- this place is in the best location. If you have time- stay somewhere else. It's also amusing that the hotel states that the 8th floor is "temporarily closed"- until 2007. Last time I checked, it was 2009. It's still closed!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away !! Stuck in an elevator !!!”
Reviews.Author: ice_harvester
Reviews.Content: Due to an early flight out of MIA, my wife and I decided to stay here so that we could return our rental car the night before. Keep in mind that all OTHER hotels near the airport have free shuttles. Shortly after arriving (before returning the rental car), I left our room to get our luggage. When I got to the lobby, the elevator door would not open. After using the emergency phone and waiting 40 minutes, Fire/Rescue showed up to pry open the doors. one of the FR personnel told me that due to the age of the elevators, they get the same call 3-4 times/week. For my trouble, management was kind enough to provide me with a $10 food coupon at the airport (enough to buy a bagel). It was just dumb luck I was not on my way to catch a plane!! DIRTY ROOMS, LOUSY SERVICE, RUN AWAY and stay at ANY other hotel near MIA. Good luck to those who don't listen.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaTrekkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the airport hotel for one night, breaking up an afternoon flight into MIA and a morning flight out. I had read some previous mixed reviews, and so I was cautiously concerned about the hotel's quality, especially the size of its rooms. My initial decision was to book a "superior" room; it turned out to be large, nicely decorated, and -- most important -- quiet. Upon checking in, I also requested a renovated room, based on previous reviews regarding room quality. The desk clerk advised me that all room renovations had now been completed. The hotel's location is especially convenient. It is right in the center of the Miami airport on the departures level; the hotel lobby is integrated into the airport concourse. And finally, we received an internet price for our room that was much lower than any of the comparable hotels near the airport. All in all, this was one of the best decisions we made regarding our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Convenience”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: It is so nice after arriving on a night time flight, to just take an elevator up 2 flights, and you are there.We were only there 1 night and the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine with nice amenities.The room is soundproofed well from the outside noise, but hallway noise was easily heard. Front desk was prompt in bringing up toothbrush kits for my husband and I. Our only glitch on this trip was AA's told us we had to collect our luggage in Miami, and recheck it the next morning for San Juan.After waiting over an hour for our luggage, we went to baggage services, who told us our bags were checked all the way thru to S.J, which makes more sense.Hence the need for the toothbrush kits. Luckily we had extra clothes in our carry ons.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for early flights”
Reviews.Author: Kazza59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before an early morning flight. However the staff forgot our wake up call and therefore flight was missed. Apart from that the hotel was clean, comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable location”
Reviews.Author: aleponti
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a night in this hotel while travelling to Bahamas. The room was comfortable and clean. Bathroom was very little but clean. We just wanted to sleep because we were very tired and we had a flight the day after, so this was the perfect solution for us due to the location. But I think it's too expensive for what it gives to you. The lobby was very very dirty and I was afraid about the room (fortunately it was very clean, with a soft and big bed!!) The breakfast room was so cold that it was almost impossible for us to eat there. Anyway, it has the best location if you are travelling, so I think they take advantage from this. It doesn't value the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the location”
Reviews.Author: listony
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in MIA with a missed connection so no luggage and AA unable to supply an amenity kit. Also they were unwilling to supply accommodation as the delay was not "the fault of AA!" At 11pm we had no interest in finding off site hotels as we would also have an early check in the following morning. So it was expensive but so what! We have stayed at other brands at that price and been pleased. We got to the room to find that it is about the size of a cheap motel room. Luckily we had no luggage to stow! The front desk sent up one(!) toothbrush and toothpaste. There was soap int the bathroom and towels. Probably because there is not room for anything else. (oh there is a wall mounted hairdryer) The bed was comfortable but the covering along with the carpet was stained. Still we were out by 7.30 am and had a short walk to security. It does have that as a redeeming feature.

Reviews.Title: “Location IN the airport buiding!”
Reviews.Author: Kirpan
Reviews.Content: When you have survived immigration you are happy to find your hotel room without leaving the airport building. Price is maybe a little higher than other hotels around the airport but think of the time saved and consider that otherwise you would have to take taxis and/or wait for a shuttle. The hotel serves its purpose. The corridors are rather awful but the rooms are big enough and they offer all you need. And of course practically all guests will be staying for only one night. I stayed there again on my night flight back to Europe as I had to check out at 11.00 a.m. from a Pal Harbour hotel and got a day rate of about $100 for a stay from 11.00 to 18.00 hrs. This worked out even cheaper than paying for an extended check out in the other hotel where check out time was 11.00. Staying one hour longer was 25% of the daiy rate, 2 hrs. 40% and over 2 hrs was full day rate. Miami airport hotel gives me the chance to check in with the airline, go back to the hotel and wait till boarding

Reviews.Title: “Fulfills its purpose very well”
Reviews.Author: GirlMouse
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with the last review. As a hotel, this is an average hotel, but you really can't beat the location. As merely a hotel room, I would maybe give this a 3.5, but the perfect location for my purposes raises this to a 4. We arrived at MIA after traveling 16 hours, and all that I wanted at that point was quickly a nice quiet room with a good bed. This hotel offered that, so I was happy. It was really a huge relief that the hotel was located inside the airport, surely at least after a long trip. We arrived late at night, and carried on first thing in the morning, for which purpose this hotel was very very good. Slept like a baby, so no noise and the bed was good. The room was clean and nice, I have no complaints. The corridor outside the rooms was outdated and dirty, however. Would book again if need be. With a shorter flight that arrives earlier, could try also other hotels located near the airport. But for late in flights, this is really the only sensible option.

Reviews.Title: “Major convenience but not much else”
Reviews.Author: travelwithnancy
Reviews.Content: Staff was not very welcoming. As mentioned by others, this is one of the smallest rooms I have ever booked. The bathroom door literally hit the toilet anytime we entered the bathroom. HOWEVER -- the hotel looks great when you have 5AM check in for an international flight and just have to walk down the concourse to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Layover”
Reviews.Author: ToddlerTravel
Reviews.Content: We had a 12 hour, overnight layover on our way back from Costa Rica...and this was perfect for us after traveling all day with a 5 year old. We got through customs, checked in, took showers, grabbed some pizza and beers in the terminal, took them back to the room and relaxed. In the morning, we simply took the elevator back down and were right at the security check-point. If you have a layover in Miamiâ€¦you can't beat this hotel. Rooms were small, but clean...no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Environment for our one night stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler2828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the night of November 8th on our way back from our Mexican vacation. We flew in on American Airlines direct from Cancun to Miami, FL late in the afternoon. My original intent was to go to the most convenient hotel for arriving and departing passengers as my family was looking forward to a quick nights' sleep as we needed to get up early to catch our early morning flight back home. We were not disappointed. As we exited the secure zone from the arrival gates, I asked directions to the hotel and the reality was that all we had to do was go up to the 2nd level, that's where check-ins take place and the hotel was within 100 ft of the American Airlines gate exit. The hotel check-in was quick and I did ask for a renovated room as I knew this hotel was undergoing renovations. By the way, the hotel website directly states that the hotel facilities and major activity areas are under construction. The pool was unavailable as well as the tennis courts and other areas as indicated on their website. So any traveler doing their own research should have discovered this before arriving and if not, they did not do due diligence. After checkout out the United gates were quite far away. I believe the hotel is centrally located so any airline with gates near the ends of the airport will entail long walks. The room was adequately roomy. We had two queen beds, which were perfect for my wife,my son and I. The beds were quite comfortable as they use pillow top mattresses, at least in their renovated rooms. The decor was nice and modern and in great shape. The water worked fine. They use a single wide rain type shower head in the tub. The rooms were quite sound proof an we did not hear any airplane sounds at all. There was plenty of lights, often for me a minor irritant, but it was not a problem here. The hotel has ice machines on every guest floor and a vending machine as well. The hotel also provides a copy of the local Miami Herald in the morning. The local restaurants open at 7:00 am so if you have a flight too early in the morning you will be out of luck for breakfast. All in all, I was quite happy with my admittedly short stay. Checkout was a breeze as we pre-paid and incurred no additional charges.

Reviews.Title: “: "Miserable Manager and dirty rooms !!!"”
Reviews.Author: Travelnut1000
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11pm, for an overnight stay before cruising the next day. Front desk staff NOT friendly at all. Went to our "non-smoking room", but it stunk of cigarettes. The dust on the dressers was thick..but hey, it was just for a night. Too tired to complain. When we went to check out I was overbilled as I had booked with an agency (Hotelkingdom.com) and my e-mail showed my balance owing. Front desk staff were totally vacant, not a clue. They called for the Manager, who basically said "too bad" - take it up with the agency. I then told her about the smoking and dust in the room..and she just said "you seem like someone who likes to complain". I will never stay here again....and I travel quite alot. I will be sure to let everyone know who is going to Miami !! Oh and the Manager also stated in the last 4 years, not one person has ever complained to her! Interesting, she needs to come on here and read the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere But Here! - Unless You Are Desperate”
Reviews.Author: RD57
Reviews.Content: Had a connection at MIA, late arrival, early departure. Figured I'd save the trouble of going to a "real" hotel off airport. Bad idea. Booked a "Superior" room at $231 for one night. About double the cost of any other nearby off-airport hotel, and about half the room size. Opened the door to the room and found the temperature at 107 degrees, with the bathroom at over 115 degrees (my digital thermometer doesn't read higher!). This temp was with the A/C on at full cooling! All of the room lights were on as well, which contributed to the sauna-like conditions in the room. Almost no airflow from the A/C vents. Opened up the return vent and found the air filter had about 1/4 inch of filth over the entire surface. Removed it and brought it down to the front desk. Their response? Nothing! Not even a shrug! Amazing non-interest. Apparently this hotel has enough "stay one time only" traffic to not care about anything. It took three hours to bring the room temp down to under 80 degrees. For my return connection, stayed off airport at the Embassy Suites for half the price. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Filthy Hotel, Not Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: cry9m
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and it was a complete disaster the room had outdated furniture, the bathroom had remnants of previous guest hair and bodily stains as did the blankets and sheets on the bed, the cable sucked and only provided the basic news stations, and the room was infested with ants. The decor in the elevator and rooms was either peeling, cracked, stained, or contained some foul stench and I could say that I literally became sick because of lack of housekeeping that occurred during my stay. The room came without a mini fridge or microwave and when they provided the mini fridge it was rusted out and dirty. For the amount of money charged to stay in the hotel the service, decor, and cleanliness should be at a much higher standard. I hope that with this review I could save some other traveler heartache from wasting their money staying in this horrendous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “#1 in Comfort”
Reviews.Author: rosebud100
Reviews.Content: I had a flight cancellation and had to spend one night at the hotel.....Honestly, I had the best night's sleep there. (Wish I could've taken that bed home with me!!) The rooms are renovated and completely soundproofed. I didn't even feel like I was anywhere NEAR an airport. The room was immaculate, the bathroom clean, everything was in proper working order ( the A/C, hot water, TV, everything).........no complaints at all from me! The service at the restaurant was not bad, and the food was great. Tip - try the cheesecake, it's "to die for"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sapphiregirlkaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our a problem with a flight home to the UK. It's right in the airport terminal and therefore is very convenient. The restaurant serves good quality meals but is fairly expensive as are the rooms. The rooms are not large but are very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What an improvement”
Reviews.Author: Tita75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and can honestly say the only incovenience I saw before was that you could hear doors being slammed all accross the hallways. I was surprised when I visited a couple of days ago how they fixed the doors and now there is ABSOLUTE silence. It was a great improvement from my last stay in Oct. 2007. The rooms have been refurbished and the room service is great after a long trip. Nothing beats staying inside the hotel and not having to drag your bags in and out of cars. I will continue to stay at this hotel, the staff is great and took our luggage all the way to our airline. Loved it! I recommend the breakfast on the top floor. It has a great view and is a good value compared to anything else you might find at the terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay before an early flight!”
Reviews.Author: racerdog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this week with my family since we had an early flight the next day. I was feeling kind of apprenhensive of the place in the lobby/elevator/hallway, but relaxed as soon as I saw our room. It was nicely appointed, very quiet, with a decent bathroom, and comfy beds. Very nice to roll right out of bed and head to the gate for our flight. Nice showerhead too!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel "lost" my reservation”
Reviews.Author: 754forrest
Reviews.Content: I stay here several times a year, mostly business. It is the only hotel in the terminal and very convenient. Rooms are smallish but comfortable, and overall it is an acceptable hotel for a short transit-type visit.. I recently guaranteed a one night stay with a CC, but when arriving after a long business and travel day, the hotel was "full" and my reservation was nowhere to be found. At 2330 at night, this is not good news. Obviously, the front desk staff ( with minimal apology ), thought that I was not coming, and gave my room to another guest. I found another close-by hotel, but was 90 minutes later than planned in getting some rest. I will not stay here again. Minor consolation : no charge to my CC :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Convenience, terrible front desk staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: gee1209
Reviews.Content: We fly into Miami a day before our cruise and stayed at this hotel because of the convenience. The hotel itself was very nice, actually nicer then expected. The only problem - and it was enough for me to only give this hotel 2 stars - was the front desk staff. Three families checked in, we were all charged a higher rate then indicated on our confirmation. We were then told not to worry - it would be changed when we check out. The next morning when we checked out (thank goodness we didn't use the express automatic check out) we were incorrectly charged - everyone's credit card was place with different rooms - it was a real mess. I wouldn't be upset about this normally, but the attitude of the "management" behind the desk was horrible... she didn't want to explain the problem , just keep sighing at us, telling us they made the corrections, she didn't want to give us any back up that the charges were removed. She was a real "B" if you ask me! I was never spoken to in such a matter, and when I tried to explain to her that once we left we had no proof that this was actually done, she told me "I explained this to you to many times"...SHe would not give me last name...she was just totally out of line. Because of staff like this - I would never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Happy for the convenience”
Reviews.Author: peregrin8
Reviews.Content: I was leery to stay here after reading some of the reviews, but I was glad my husband and I stayed here. We were happy to find a clean room after arriving around midnight and had a morning flight. The room had been updated and the bed was comfortable. It was quiet, too. We could tell the hotel is older, but the rooms were nicely done. It was great not to have to catch a shuttle to get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “UGH!”
Reviews.Author: Ed-Bogus
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Miami International Airport Hotel. Our experience taught us that LOCATION IS NOT EVERYTHING. The room and "amenities" made us feel like we were bait-and-switch victims. We complained to the staff and shift supervisor. We were not offered an apology or discount. They could not give a (bleep). We have since learned there are some great hotels very close with caring staff, 24//7 airport shuttle service, and many more amenities. In the future we will avoid the Miami International Airport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds and pillows”
Reviews.Author: natureniche
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport at 2 am and wearily dragged our bags a concourse or 2 but it was nice not having to wait outside for a taxi. The convenience of this hotel is great! We were on the 7th floor and the restaurant is just down the hallway. Not even an elevator ride. The rooms were standard in spaciousness but the beds were dreamy for a late arrival. The bathroom was pretty good, all enclosed instead of having the sink separate from the toilet and shower. One weird thing was that the bathroom door was on a hinge that made it shut automatically. Wasn't sure what this was about. Also our room didn't have a closet but I noticed that other rooms did. The desk clerks were efficient and helpful but not effusively so. I would stay here again. Some noise in the hall from running children but I didn't find the jet noise bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “It works.”
Reviews.Author: yarsor
Reviews.Content: II stayed to rest for my next flght. It is a good hotel for a one night stay. The room are very small and I could not see myself spending more than one night there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfy...just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: belindac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on 2/2/08. I was quite apprehensive, as we have had bad Miami airport hotel experiences in the past, and the reviews were mixed. We were in for a pleasant surprise. First, the location was perfect for our flight departing at 11:30am. Check in was quick and easy, and we received one of the newly renovated rooms which was tastefully decorated, had a great, cushy king size bed, and the room was very clean. Even looking out the window at the runway, we could not hear the planes land or depart. The location allowed us to check in to our flights early, securing us exit row seating. Then we had a leisurely breakfast at the hotel restaurant, where we had great service. The only negative I could come up with would be that the cabinet holding the tv is extremely wide, making the passage between the cabinet and bed narrow. A flat screen might solve that problem! The shower pressure was great, with a rain type shower head. Overall, we felt the price justified the convenience.
